The game itself is rather basic. It has a folding thin cardboard field and 18 small wooden player disks (9 blue, 9 red). While there are circles on the field and bench for these pieces, their only real function is to mark baserunners.

To bat, players simply roll 2D6, and read the resulting play off a 2-12 table in the rules. The odds are not realistic: the most likely result (7) produces a double, and a batter will get on base almost half the time (17/36). Normal baseball rules apply, with the player scoring the most runs after nine innings winning.

212802.description: A promo card for Dixit 7 Revelations. The card shows a bunny doing a magic trick with the hat.

214849.description:
Build or BOOM is a fast-paced two-player game that will test speed and shape recognition.

GETTING STARTED: Draw a construction card (3 levels of difficulty) and place it on the card holder in between the 2 players.

HOW TO PLAY: Race to be the first to stack your blocks exactly as shown on the construction card. When you finish yell BOOM! & hit the dynamite blast pad sending the other player's tower to the ground.

WHAT'S INCLUDED: 40 various blocks, 2 Construction Workers, 2 Boomers/Platforms, 30 Construction Cards with 3 levels of difficulty

The object of Build or Boom is to be the first player to build the plans on the Blueprint Card. Once your building is done, smash your Boomer and your opponent's structure comes tumbling down. If your tower matches exactly what's on the card, score a point. Replace the blocks in the middle of the table and play again with a new Blueprint Card. The first Builder to 10 points wins.

214850.description:
This Walker mini and card for The Walking Dead: All Out War Miniatures Game was released as a promo in Game Trade Magazine (GTM) Issue No. 201 November.

The unpainted mini is female, wearing a dress. The card provides the following stats:

15 points
Melee: 1 red die
Defense: 1 red die




Outnumbering: A single Walker in a combat rolls its Melee value as normal (1 red die). A second Walker in the same combat rolls 2 red dice; the third Walker rolls 3 red dice, and so on, up to a maximum of 5 red dice.

name.#text: The Walking Dead: All Out War – Walker Mini and Card

214852.description:
This mid-1930s title was probably the last American football game published in which the drop kick and place kick were shown as different ways to attempt a field goal or extra point - with the drop kick being more likely to succeed. The standard football was made more pointed at the ends in 1934 to make it easier to pass, but the new shape made drop kicks much less reliable, and almost all scoring attempts since have been place kicks.

The game uses the sum of 2D6 to resolve each play. The offensive player has 10 play options (Left End, Left Tackle, Left Guard, Center, Right Guard, Right Tackle, Right End, Spinner Play, Trick Play and Pass). Each of these plays, along with Drop Kick, Place Kick, Punt, Punt Return, Kickoff and Kickoff Return) has its own results column showing yards gained or lost along with possible fumbles and interceptions.

The board has an unusual mechanism for recording the game's progress. It comes with just two pawns, one for recording downs, the other the number of plays. The field has four groups of lines stretching from one end of the field to the other to mark the downs (single, double, triple and quadruple lines), and the ball marker is moved from one to the next to mark downs as well as back and forth to show line of scrimmage. The second peg marks off plays at the end of the board, with a quarter ending after 25 plays and the game after 100. Usual football scoring applies, with most points after 100 plays winning.

217398.description:
The Realms lay divided, their former wonder lost and forgotten. The Tyrant Queen has seized the throne, forcing the rightful heirs deep into exile. You are the sons and daughters of the once-great houses: Foxway, Gorga, Mherzeen, and Spyre. Under the tutelage of advisors, you have gathered your followers, your conscripts. The time has come to take back what is yours.

Path of Light and Shadow is a massive empire-building experience, combining area control, deck building, and civilization customization. As players vie for control of The Realms, they must enlist and promote supporters, outfit their burgeoning empire with powerful technologies, align with powerful leaders, and lay siege to rival exiles after the throne. Above all else, each player must decide what type of leader they will become, cruel or merciful. But choose wisely, for each path has its rewards and perils.

214861.description:
Monsters in the Elevator is a cooperative math card game for 2-6 players, ages 7-to-11 (and up). It takes 2 minutes to learn and 5-20 minutes to play. It won Best Family Game at the 2016 Boston Festival of Indie Games.

There are two decks: 20 Floors, which are stacked in order lowest on top, and the Draw deck, which includes 64 Monsters (with weights displayed on their bodies) and 14 Actions (that make Monsters exit or change the Floor).

GAMEPLAY:
Sit in a circle: the center is the Elevator. The Elevator capacity is 50 x the number of players. Deal 3 Draw cards to each player, and play the 1st round. Each Floor is a round of the game, with 4 steps:
1. CHANGE THE FLOOR: Play the next card up.
2. PERFORM EXITS: Check the exit conditions on the Floor and Monster cards in the Elevator to see if any leave.
3. DO ENTRANCES: Each player chooses a card from their hand and places it faces down. After a count to three, all players flip. If there are actions, play them! If an action changes the floor, skip step 4 and do exits on the new floor.
4. DO THE MONSTER COUNT: Get the sum of the Monster weights. If the sum exceeds the Elevator capacity then the Elevator crashes and everyone loses. If the sum is below capacity, deal a 3rd card to each player and play the next round!

ADVANCED PLAY: Remove the 20th Floor card, shuffle the remaining 19 Floor cards, place the Floors deck face down with 20th floor at bottom, and play each round with no idea what is coming next.

214863.description:
A children's game based on a famous Swedish TV-show for kids. 28 double-sided tiles are spread out on the board. The goal of the game is to collect as many as possible of the things that has been spread out in different rooms and workshops of the Daedalus.

On your turn you try to get completed sets based on the picture of the tile. The sets are between 2 to 5 tiles. You can even steal tiles from the other players if you can take a complete set. Then you flip the tiles over for the other side.

The player with the most tiles when every tile is taken wins the round and gets a point-marker. First player to get three points wins.

Labyrint: Flip is a standalone game but can also be played an extra challenge to Labyrint.

217402.description:
The goal is to gather the most Pokémons of different sets, for an example grass, water, or psycic Pokémons.

You do this by taking turns throwing a 1d6 and a 1d12 die. You sum up the result and take a avaible Pokémon card from a grid of cards with that number.

Once per turn you can evolve your Pokémons if you have the criterias to do so, which means you can swap your Pokémon card for a more powerful version.

You do this until the draw piles are depleted. Then, each player sum up each set and compare. The winner of a set gets a point. The player with the most points is the winner.

214879.description:
Get the treasure, and get out! If only it were that easy...

In Tomb Trader, you and your friends have joined an archaeological excavation — not for the sake of antiquity or history, but simply in the hopes of lining your pockets with the best treasures and smuggling them back to civilization. Each day, sneak back into the tomb to loot high-value items, but watch out because your ne'er-do-well friends all have the same idea! You have to be a swift and skilled negotiator in order to divvy up the loot before being caught, while making sure you get the best cuts for yourself!

The game consists of 6 or 7 rounds in which players select a section of the tomb to explore and have one minute to divide the treasure between everyone else in the same section. Not coming to an agreement means nobody gets anything!

214880.description:
Description from the publisher:

After the great Chicago Fire of 1871, the brave men and women of Chicago sought to rebuild their once great city, and rebuild they did. Over the next 60 years Chicago experienced an economic golden age of such great progress The World's Fair - Columbian Exposition was hosted there in 1893 and again as great Century of Progress in 1931.

Many of the household name brands we've come to know and love today had their start in Chicago during this time period. This includes many of the meatpacking and food companies of the era: Oscar Mayer, Kraft, Quaker Oats, Nabisco, Swift & Co, Armour & Co, Schwinn Bicycles, Charles Schwab, and many others.

In City of the Big Shoulders players take on the role of entrepreneurs and investors looking to rebuild Chicago into a city fit for a world stage. In this unique merger of 18xx style stock manipulation mechanics with euro-style gameplay, players start companies, trade in shares, hire workers to man their factories and produce and sell goods to be delivered to homes across the midwest.

Although City of the Big Shoulders features a large amount of depth, strategy, and rewarding gameplay it features a shorter timeline than other heavy economic games of it's caliber. Players play just six rounds, in about 2 and a half hours. Each round consists of an an event, a company operation phase, share payouts, and a stock phase. At the end of these six rounds, the player with the best stock and money portfolio at the end of the game wins. Once complete, players cash out their shares for their final stock value, tally their money and celebrate in their economic victory.

After all, wouldn't you like to have solidified your economic legacy before the worst economic crisis in US History? I know I would.

214881.description:
Cat detectives have begun investigations to search for missing cats. Will they be able to bring missing cats safely?

This game is designed to be enjoyed by two players.
Each player must be a cat-detective to find cats that have disappeared.

Each player mixes his own 15 tool cards to create a stack of cards, then draws 2 cards, puts them in front of him, draws one card into his hand.

combine 14 cat cards to create a stack of cards, then draw 3 cards and unfold them in the table.

On your turn, the player chooses one of the two cards you have unfolded or one card in your hand. Place the card in one of the cat cards in the center.

Each cat card has the number of tools the cats want. As soon as the number is filled, the number of cards used by each detective is compared immediately. Follow detectives with high numbers of tools.

When putting down the card, you can not put it down with the same sum.

The composition of the 15 tool cards is the same for each player, and once used, cards can not be reused until all cards are used. Take advantage of special cards, remember your opponent and my remaining cards, and use your cards to bring as many cats as you can.

First of all, collect 5 kinds of cats or collect 2 pairs of 2 or more identical cat cards.

214885.description:
Pijamas stands for the french "Papa Il Joue Avec Moi Aux Soldats" (Daddy plays toysoldiers with me). It is a family of miniatures rulesets which are simple, quick, efficient, educational and fun, with the youngsters as primary target. They all provide a core ruleset which can be completed by optional rules when players see fit. These optional rules add historical flavor and more tactical choices but no complexity.
The system uses only D6.

The first installment in these series is Omaha which was published in the Vae Victis magazine 116.

Omaha covers the famous D-Day landings with two scenarios which can be played alone or in campaign mode: Dog Green; Vierville.

Sequence of play:
1-Player A : Movement
2-Player A: Firing and Melee
1-Player B : Movement
2-Player B: Firing and Melee

214887.description:
This new totally re-designed edition will bring a completely new iconography, an entirely new rulebook with lots of 3D pictures for easy comprehension of the rules, more balanced gameplay, a new events deck, improved and streamlined mechanisms, upgraded wood components for the power plants instead of the cardboard tokens, while maintaining the beautiful illustrations on the board and cover, and all this with a shorter play length.

This version will also bring a cooperative mode of play. And a solo play based on goals.

In the 1970s, the governments of the world faced unprecedented demand for energy, and polluting power plants were built everywhere in order to meet that demand. Year after year, the pollution they generate increases, and nobody has done anything to reduce it. Now, the impact of this pollution has become too great, and humanity is starting to realize that we must meet our energy demands through clean sources of energy. Companies with expertise in clean, sustainable energy are called in to propose projects that will provide the required energy without polluting the environment. Regional governments are eager to fund these projects and to invest in their implementation.

If the pollution isn't stopped, it's game over for all of us.

In the game CO₂, each player is the CEO of an energy company responding to government requests for new, green power plants. The goal is to stop the increase of pollution while meeting the rising demand for sustainable energy — and of course profiting from doing so. You will need enough expertise, money, and resources to build these clean power plants. Energy summits will promote global awareness, and allow companies to share a little of their expertise while learning still more from others.

In CO₂, each region starts with a certain number of Carbon Emissions Permits (CEPs) at its disposal. These CEPs are granted by the United Nations, and they must be spent whenever the region needs to install the energy infrastructure for a project or to construct a fossil fuel power plant. CEPs can be bought and sold on a market, and their price fluctuates throughout the game. You will want to try to maintain control over the CEPs.

Money, CEPs, Green Power Plants that you've built, UN Goals you've completed, Company Goals you've met, and Expertise you've gained all give you Victory Points (VPs), which represent your Company's reputation — and having the best reputation is the goal of the game … in addition to saving the planet, of course.
214887.name: CO2 (second edition)

214892.description:
Numerous dangers await you as you set out on the journey to the final tower. The sharp teeth of the shark are wating for you to fall into the water. Challenge your friends - see who can outwit the shark and reach the finish first.

Gameplay: The players move forward from tower to tower, across numerous gangplanks, by throwing the dice. Beware! At any moment the shark can move into action; the gangplanks will fall through and the players will be in the water. The player who gets to the final tower with the most counters is the winner.

214895.description:
Based on the popular finnish comic Fingerpori by Pertti Jarla.

Collect the largest fortune in this "hardcore" business game.
Bribe the mayor or send your money to a nigerian prince. Do whatever it takes to increase your wealth.

Players rolls a die, moves around the board and follows instructions on board/card.

The player who collects most money wins.

214896.description:
Experience the perfect vacation.

Perhaps your idea of a perfect vacation is relaxing pool side with a forgotten novel, or enjoying the serenity of the setting sun on the vast expanse of the ocean. Maybe you find inspiration on a challenging golf course or rejuvenate by dining with friends in the privacy of your own magnificent residence. Or, possibly it is the deep winter powder in Deer Valley and the fresh air of a summer hike. No matter how you define it, a lifetime of perfect vacations is yours as a member of Exclusive Resorts.

Whether you're on vacation with us, or just daydreaming about your next getaway in one of our destinations, we invite you to enjoy your Exclusive Resorts Member's Edition of the MONOPOLY game. As you'll see, the game tokens represent various aspects of vacation and the board spaces represent our many sought-after destinations. Control the board to own it all in the world of perfect vacations. We hope you enjoy the MONOPOLY game play experience while imagining your next perfect vacation with Exclusive Resorts.

Games Includes : Game Board, Title Deed Cards, Play Money & Banker’s Tray, 16 Destinations Cards, 16 Activities Cards, 32 Residences, 12 Resorts, Rules, 8 Custom Pewter Tokens, 2 Dice

214897.description: Mouthguard Challenge contains five mouthguards and more than 75 challenges that will test your ability to whisper, read, and do much more while wearing a mouthguard. Four revenge cards are included!

214898.description:
Description from the publisher:

Space is the worst — empty, black, airless, awash in radiation, and dotted with immense clods of flaming plasma that make everything within millions of miles too hot to support life. If your living room were like space, you'd never ever go there.

In Gloom in Space, you make your rag-tag band or star-faring heroes miserable, then kill them. Sci-fi archetypes like the Smuggler, Captain, Doctor, and Dark Lord fight their fathers, meddle with monoliths, get caught in compactors, and wind up getting nuked from orbit. Eventually, enough Untimely Deaths come to pass that the game ends. And then? The most miserable crew wins.

Gloom in Space is a standalone game that's also compatible with all existing Gloom core games and expansions.

214899.description:
Watch Ya' Mouth contains a bunch of mouthguards and more than nine hundred phrases on 143 cards that you will find extremely challenging to say while sporting a mouthguard. Can you communicate clearly enough that others will guess what you're trying to say?

The game is designed to play as teams usually of 2. One person wears a cheek retractor similar to what you get at a dentist. Then they read a phrase on a card with the equipment in their mouth. Their teammate(s) are supposed to try and repeat the phrase correctly back (without the retractors).

The team with the most correct answers wins.

214900.description: Lost in R'lyeh: Unholy Presents is a single card expansion for Lost in R'lyeh that forces each player to give one card to the player on their left, then banishes the stack.

214902.description: Watch Yo Mouth! contains a bunch of mouthguards and dozens of phrases on cards that you will find extremely challenging to say while sporting a mouthguard. Can you communicate clearly enough that others will guess what you're trying to say?

214903.description:
Doggy acrobats are coming to town! They practiced so hard before the show, but unfortunately, their trainer has fallen ill! What should they do without their trusted trainer? How can they keep the practice going? Oh! Maybe the new trainer can help them out! Come on! The doggy show is counting on you now!

Doggy Go! is a speed game in which players try to be the first to complete the patterns on acrobat cards with their doggy tiles. Whoever scores the most acrobat cards in the end wins!

This edition of Doggy Go! contains both the original Doggy Go! game and the Doggy Go! Plus expansion.

216042.description:
Vs System 2PCG: Legacy is a set of two hundred cards that expands on all of the Marvel Universe teams released to date for the Vs System 2PCG line: The Marvel Battles, The Defenders, and A-Force. Each team gains a new main character and a few supporting characters, including fan favorites such as Captain Britain, Psylocke, Mister Sinister, Taskmaster, Squirrel Girl, and Elektra.

Vs System 2PCG: Legacy also includes replacement main character cards for Thanos as the original cards in The Marvel Battles set were subsequently shown to distort play on the tournament scene.

214910.description:
In Tiki, you are a divinity on Manami Island and you love all the delicious fruits that grow there. You prefer nothing more than influencing the living tribes of the island to share their gifts with you. Unfortunately, you aren't the only one. Another divinity shares your passion for these fruits, which leaves you only one choice — you need to show him your power in order to get more fruits than he does before the end of the fruit season.

To set up, shuffle the nine village tiles and place them in a 3x3 square with some space between each tile. Players then take turns until the fruit supply exhausted or one of them collects four fruits. On a turn, a player creates a new totem (by placing one of their totem tokens on an empty village tile) or moves a totem that has one of their tokens on top. When you move a totem, you must move the entire totem orthogonally as many spaces as the number of tokens in it. As you move, you drop the bottommost token in each village through which you pass, placing the dropped tokens on top of any totem already located there.

When a totem has three tokens stacked in it, the village it's in is influenced, with the player who owns the top token winning a number of fruits equal to the number on the village tile. After this, remove the tokens in this totem and return them to their owners. If a village has a 0 on it, then the tokens are returned with no one collecting fruit; if a village has -1, then the owner of the top totem removes one of their collected fruits from the game.

As soon as a player has four fruit, they win. If the fruit supply is empty, the game ends and whoever has the most fruit wins; in the event of a tie, continue to play until one player would win (or lose) a fruit to determine the winner.

Once you've played a few times, start using the Shaman rule. The second player places a Shaman between two villages before their first move, and no totem can be moved between these two villages. When a village with value 0 is influenced, the owner of the topmost token can move the Shaman to a new location, if desired.

212629.description:
"The stolen items will be taken by me... no, us!"
The knights would like to take the honor, ... no, they want just a public interesting. Additionally, they are very sly for all. They can take the credit from other knights for the own.

This game is a collecting card game.
Each player has a card pile with a same card set. Each player draws 5 cards, and places 2 cards on the front from them as scoring cards for all.

Then, each player places one card to the stolen item from a hand clockwise, and the knights pick up them. But please take care of, only the LAST PLAYED PLAYER to the stolen item can take it and get the points.
The winner is the player with most points.
212629.name: Oodorobo to Zurui Naito (大どろぼうとズルい騎士)

216726.description:
The 10th rune stone: awarded to first player to erect both their temples



Protective Amulet: given to first player to build four huts.



The Spring: Affects druids crossing the great river.


These promo items are contained in the HABA catalog that was given away for free at Essen 2016. Rules can be found on the publisher's website.

214924.description:
The Expansion Bundle for Princes of the Renaissance introduces:


6 player boards;
Extra Event Tiles (this expansion adds two new Event Tiles to each era in the game so the players cannot be 100% certain which events will affect play until the next era is upon them. This rewards players who have a flexible strategy, and further enhances the game's replayability);
Extra City Tiles (each city would now have two alternate City Tiles that create some variability to the gameplay);
Pope Standee;
Extra Gold and Influence Counters.

name.#text: Princes of the Renaissance: Expansion Bundle

214932.description:
LET'S ROLL AND BOARD!

OBJECTIVE : FIRE YOUR DICE AND SINK THE OTHER PIRATE SHIPS

CONTENTS:
6 dice
4 game boards
69 cannonball tokens
1 skull and crossbones token

Each player has a game board with 8 pirates, 5 cannons labelled one to five and 2 hull zones. To remain afloat, the ship’s captain must still have at least one pirate, one cannon and one hull zone. The objective is to sink your opponents’ ships by rolling dice combinations:

two of a kind (2 identical dice) wounds one pirate.
three of a kind (3 identical dice) breaks a cannon.
four of a kind (4 identical dice) damages a hull zone.

214933.description:
Players explore their imaginations and test their memories while creating silly stories about 27 different animal tokens. Players share wacky stories as they place their tokens facedown in a room. Be careful, there are Memory Monsters lurking in the palace trying to confuse. Successfully remember where each animal is on the board without turning over a Memory Monster and everyone wins!

Kids have fun creating silly stories and pushing their imaginations to the limits! Silly animals and colorful rooms of the palace keep kids engaged and their stories even sillier!

Components:
16 Palace tiles
27 Animal tokens
3 Memory Monster tokens

214940.description:
Two triangles or three blue?

In sconos, you can see your own game pieces only from behind, but you want to know which symbol is visible on the front. Information about these symbols will be made available with each roll of the dice, and whoever can smartly combine those details quickly will reveal the mystery of their pieces first.

218096.description: The first player to pass their turn receives the Participation Ribbon worth victory points at game end.

214951.description:
There are all kinds of strange combinations of food at the Blue Plate Diner. Players have 30 seconds to remember which foods go with which plates without looking. Make it through breakfast, lunch, and dinner without making your customers angry, and everyone wins!

Components:
36 plate tiles
36 food cards
1 score board

214959.description:
A 69” box called the Please do not buy this product box. It costs $100 and you actually shouldn’t buy it.

69 inches long.
No returns.

Includes 1 card ("The even biggest, blackester d**k").

name.#text: Cards Against Humanity: Please do not buy this product.

214965.description:
"Oh No! The local CO-OP market is drowning in debt and the giant corporation MondoMart is threatening to take it over! The city has given the CO-OP just a few weeks to clean up its act. The CO-OP needs to raise money to pay back taxes and legal fees, or the city will sell the CO-OP and its assets to MondoMart to pay off the debts.

How can the CO-OP survive?

The CO-OP owners, all HIPPIES, have invited some like-minded business types to help them save the store. These folks, the so-called BIZZIES (BUSIness people: pronounced like biz-zees), will have to work together with the HIPPIES to save the CO-OP. Together, they will run it as a business (and keep it groovy), but they need to try a bunch of crazy things! However, the city's deadline is quicky approaching, so the group will have to try some pretty unorthodox methods to keep the CO-OP both profitable and groovy! They may even have to open the CO-OP to non-members!"



CO-OP: the co-op game is a cooperative, variable player powers, hand management, marketplace card game for 1-5 players ages 12 and up (although kids ages 10 and up can play with their parent's help).

In CO-OP, all players assume the role of someone who works at the CO-OP (each with special powers). Each player also has a VIBE track, representing how they are feeling today. A global Money track represents how much money the CO-OP currently has. To win, the CO-OP needs at least $10, and each player must be Groovy or Awesome on their individual VIBE chart.

Since the CO-OP is a store, the usual way to make money is to sell goods to Customers. There is a Storefront where the CO-OP stocks goods to sell to Customers. When the Storefront runs out of goods, the CO-OP can move goods from the Warehouse to the Storefront a variety of ways. When the Warehouse runs out of goods, the CO-OP has to spend some money with Distributors to get more goods. CO-OP is all about balancing when to buy, move, and sell goods. But also staying groovy!

The game is broken up into days. Each day, three things occur: A Happening, Players Turn, Clean-up. A Happening at the start of the day sets-up today's challenge. Then, each player gets a turn, usually playing a card. These cards can be Customers (who buy goods from the CO-OP Storefront), Distributors (from whom we buy goods for the Warehouse), Instagroove cards (with instantaneous effect), or Continuous Groove cards (with lasting effects). After each player plays, then we clean-up (doing end of turn maintenance). And then start to the next day!

The game is over when the Happening card GAME OVER comes out. At that time, the players either win or lose (if they have enough money and VIBE).

Players usually play cards on their turn, but they can also Meditate (to draw more cards), Frolic (cheer up their VIBE), Share (give cards back and forth with other players), and finally COOPERATE (work with other players). A sample COOPERATE action is the Car Wash: you can't have a car wash with just one person! There are limited number of COOPERATE actions, so they must be used strategically!

Players can play in any order on their turn to augment another player's turn: this is called Player Selected Turn Order, but it just means you can play in the order that best helps the players!

CO-OP is a game where players work together to discover the best way to balance VIBE, Money, Goods, and cards (Customers and Distributors). We have to make enough money to save the CO-OP ($10), but we can't give in to the man ... everyone needs to be Groovy or Awesome!

214970.description:
A strategic game of mining, ramming, looting and sabotage in an Old West mine!

ORE-SOME! is a frantic day in the mine played over 6 rounds of 2 phases each. The miner who makes the most money at the end of the day is declared the winner!

In the Move Phase, players move, ram and block each other for the best spots to dig. Rammed carts drop precious ore that can be swiped if you're quick and cunning!

In the Dig Phase, players take turns digging for, stealing or swiping dropped ore. Once they have the ore, they can sell it to the bank or rush to the Contract Agents to fill valuable contracts!
214970.name: ORE-SOME!

214971.description:
Promotional card offered by "Man vs Meeple Season One Kickstarter".

The Royal Chalice is a Royal Writ card, already sealed by the king, and grant you 3 sulfur resources from the general supply.

214978.description:
Yoli Boli is loaded with bouncy craters and hungry space pigs. Count to three, point and guess. You need cunning, memory and skill to win over your space friends in this exciting card game.

The players will be counting to three aloud. By pointing and guessing on cards, the players will win cards. The goal of the game is to gather four Crew Cards of the same kind to win: Captains, Lookouts, Engineers or Spaceships.

Activating Special Cards like Bouncy Craters, Space Yoghurt and FiFi makes the game wacky and fast paced.

218418.description:
Stadium is a contest to see who can build the strongest professional football empire!

This is a worker placement game in which the board is a three-tiered stadium. Players must build on the ground level first as they sell concessions at games, buy equipment for the team, draft all pro players, and do their best to have a winning season. Players also hire employees who can inspire fans, sell more merchandise, train team members, and make building deals as they watch their franchise rise to the sky.

Players carefully choose business decisions, watch salaries and signing bonuses, and replace broken equipment and the occasional injured player. They gain bonuses if they choose the right actions and may end up paying extra if they are not first to build new amenities to their stadium.

214988.description:
Description from the publisher:

Railways of Nippon is a standalone version of the Railways of the World series created by Glenn Drover and Martin Wallace. Hisashi Hayashi has designed this new setting in Nippon, which will be available as a new four-player base game as well as a map-and-cards-only expansion.

The new game board for Railways of Nippon is a map of Japan at the beginning of the railroad era in the late-19th century. There are new Baron cards and Operations Cards for the Railways of Nippon.

Its unique board and cards are also available as an expansion for ROTW. Played as an expansion, you need the pieces from the base game of Railways of the World (track and city tiles, bonds, money, empty city markers, trains and first player marker).

214989.description:
FIRE! Don’t let them pass through!

Find in this board game all the famous components from the best tower defense games. From the upgradable towers to the many different monster types, not forgetting resource management. But, it wouldn’t be a Devil Pig game without a touch of evilness…

Your goal is to earn the most victory points at the end of the game.

THE TURN

Each turn is composed of 3 phases: the Night, the Dawn, the Day.

During the Night, the Event card is applied and the monsters progress on your path (each type has a different movement value). Two more monsters (or your boss) appear on your path.

During the Dawn, the towers can attack one monster of a particular type on one of the 4 adjacent spaces, or the boss.

During the Day, each player can make one action between four, then they can make one more action, it can be the same.

Finally, the first player token goes to the next player.

THE ACTIONS

There is 4 different actions:
- Build a tower
- Extend your path
- Go to the market (apply one of the available Market cards)
- Make a quest (draw two cards in the Market deck)

In addition, you can play one of your Market cards in your hand after each of the three first actions, the best way to play more actions.

THE MONSTERS AND THE BOSS

Each monster type has a movement value (between 1 to 3 spaces) and maybe a special ability. All core box monsters has 2 life points.

The boss, who is not a monster, is harder to kill, with its 10 life points and when a player successes to kill him, the game is over.

Each time a monster or a boss leave your path to reach your city, you lose a number of city guards equal to their movement value. You begin at 15 and even if you lose your last one, you don't lose the game, you will just earn less victory points than the other players.

HOW TO WIN?

After the game end, each player adds the victory points from 3 sources:
- Number of remaining city guards,
- Number of damages on your boss
- Achievements (drawn randomly at the beginning of the game).

INTERACTIONS BETWEEN PLAYERS

In this game, each player has his own path and city. But, players must manage with the other players by destroying their towers, sending them monsters, reaching achievements before them, etc.

214993.description:
Each Expansion expands the game and focuses on a specific aspect of the war. We have designed the game from the start to include all the rules you need to use all the expansions!

Expansion box includes 56 cards.

This expansion features additional German hostile forces, more Action cards, more Weapons, more Equipment, more Skills, and more Mission, Objectives, and Locations!

214994.description:
Each Expansion expands the game and focuses on a specific aspect of the war. We have designed the game from the start to include all the rules you need to use all the expansions!

Expansion box includes 56 cards.

This expansion features additional British hostile forces, more Action cards, more Weapons, more Equipment, more Skills, and more Mission, Objectives, and Locations!

214996.description:
Description from the publisher:

Silver Bayonet recreates the pivotal November 1965 battle between a full North Vietnamese Army Division and the US 1st Air Cavalry Division in the Ia Drang Valley. NVA expertise in lure and ambush tactics resulted in significant US casualties. US mobility and the ability to bring massive amounts of firepower to bear quickly virtually destroyed the attacking NVA division and forced a change in NVA tactics.

This re-issue of GMT Games' 1990 CSR Award winning title that started it all keeps the original operational system, but streamlines to it to include innovative combat resolution integrating maneuver combat, close assault, artillery bombardment, and support from gunships and air sorties.

Increased accessibility to primary and secondary source material has made it possible to make changes to more accurately represent both sides' unique capabilities without significantly altering or breaking the base game system. The major changes involve patrols, ambushes, landing zones, and the 1st Cav Brigade HQ, while minor changes tweak movement, combat, and coordination game mechanics to showcase radically different strengths and weaknesses the FWA and NVA force brought to the battles in the Ia Drang Valley.

name.#text: Silver Bayonet: The First Team in Vietnam, 1965 (25th Anniversary Edition)

214999.description:
Description from the publisher:

A Surprise Slides Adventure.

Journey through the Pride Lands, helping friends along the way!

Friends of the Lion Guard need a helping hand to get to Pride Rock, and only Kion, Beshte, Bunga and Fuli can find the way. Race along the Pride Lands' paths, gathering stranded animals, but watch out - the paths can change at any time!

Roaring Rescue is a simple spin and move game for 2 to 4 players ages 3 and up.

name.#text: The Lion Guard: Roaring Rescue Game

217965.description:
Description from the publisher:

This game is based on one of the most unconventional ideas ever to have come out of international warfare – dazzle ships! Inspired by the shock and awe of Cubism and Vorticism, the dazzle ships of the First World War used a striking form of bold camouflage to confuse enemy attackers.

Use this wonderfully oddball idea to confuse your opponent and evade attacks on your fleet with this new version of the ever-popular battleships game. Includes two 64-page map-and-grid books for playing the game and a 16-page booklet explaining the history of the dazzle ships and the artistic inspiration behind them.

215001.description: In Itchi Matsu players compete in having the largest area of there own color by placing tiles of either halfnhalf black and white or black and white checkered tiles on 3x3 board. Tiles can be placed on top of other pieces as long as there are no gaps underneath. When no legal move can be made, each quadrant of your color of the tiles counts as one point. Most points wins.

215004.description:
Players compete as dragon riders using special cards to advance to the finish, while dodging attacks like ballista bolts and flaming balls. The victor wins the treasure - and even more priceless - a place in dragon-racing history!

The goal is to race from start to finish using a handful of cards to make strategic choices. Special cards that block other players' actions mean you must pay attention - even when it is not your turn.

With the ability to steal other players' cards and cards that are character-specific, sudden and significant reversals of fortune are common. Winning is never a foregone conclusion.

215005.description:
Promotional tile offered by "Man vs Meeple Season One Kickstarter".

In the game Haspelknecht, when the players acquire the Foreman, they are able to spend 1 victory point in order to activate one of their contract workers.

215007.description:
PRE-ORDER at our official website below!

This board game is a simulation of the spiritual and physical warfare that erupted after the Reformation. It is the only game that covers the specific battles that took place between the Schmalkaldic League of Confessors (the Lutherans) and the Catholic League (Holy Roman Empire) between the years 1532-1555. The setting of League of Confessors begins after the death of John the Steadfast as the leaders of the Augsburg Confession prepare to defend themselves against the impending armies of the Holy Roman Empire. Power and wealth will collide with conviction and courage as two leagues of heroes go to war with sword and the pen!

League of Confessors comes with 4 different classes of heroes.

Commanders – Commanders are the heroes that initially lead your entire army. They are good leaders in battle and are very versatile.

Generals – Generals are good leaders in battle, but that is all they will do. They can advance in their battle abilities very quickly.

Princes – Princes will help build the infrastructure of your expanding territory through the construction of armories, castles, or churches.

Confessors – Confessors do not have the ability to lead troops in battle. They are the only heroes who have the ability to publish confessional writings to convert opponents to their side.

The goal is to win the game by gaining seven Conquest Points. Each electorate territory is worth 1 Conquest Point (CP). The other way you can gain a CP is to fully advance a hero in their abilities. If you fully advance a hero in their abilities, you will also gain 1 CP for as long as that hero is alive. If your league has seven or more Conquest Points at the end of one of your turns, you win the game!

215008.description:
A Skaven expansion team with an out-of-the-box team value of 1,000,000 gold pieces. Ideal for playing against either Orcs or Humans in the base game.

Sksven teams are unique with their own stats for agility, strength, etc. in comparison to other teams. Stat sheet included.

Contains:
- 6 Linesmen
- 2 Throwers
- 2 Gutter Runners
- 2 Blitzers
- 2 team token/coins
- 2 footballs
- 1 team stats and assembly leaflet

name.#text: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): The Skavenblight Scramblers expansion

216059.description:
An adventure game of ancient India set in the world of The Mahabharata.

The five Pandava brothers are exiled to the forest for 12 years before they can claim the throne of Hastinapura. But there is no doubt their evil cousins will not relinquish it when they return and so those 12 years must be spent gathering allies and weapons to prepare for war.

You'll be exploring a map, dealing with events as you move, and defending against attacks with lots of dice. There are four kingdoms whose allegiance you seek and you can do quests for each one of them as well as personal quests to improve yourself for the coming war.

Each player character can upgrade their number of attack and defense dice as they complete quests and survive events.

There are only twelve years to get prepared for the war.

Each turn you have three movement you can use. For each step, though, you might have an encounter. These can be combats or skill checks or stat loss. Your turn ends when you can't go any further, or don't want to. Many areas can only be utilized if you begin your turn there.

You'll work together to build up reputation with four neighboring kingdoms. There are a variety of ways to do that and they can be different each game. You must also complete a personal quest. To win the game at the end of twelve years (three turns per player per year) you must have ten reputation with each of the four kingdoms and every player character must have completed his personal quest.

216743.description:
Compete with friends and family members to become the most succesful successor to Mads Skjern's business empire! A game of trivia questions based on the succesful Television series "Matador".

This game builds on questions previously used in other games with the same theme, but has a new different gaming mechanics:

All players start out with a suitcase with which they travel round the board. Players earn money by answering questions of variating difficulty.

Speciel fields on the game board, allow the players to advance from the suitcase to a small house, eventually reaching the 3 storage warehouse that Mads Skjerns ends with in the television series.

Special cards allow the players to interact by moving the player tokens on the board, stealing money from players etc.

The winner is the first player with a 3 storage warehouse to pass the starting field on the board.

Special questions are available to children playing the game with little or no prerequisites for answering Matador specific questions.

216744.description:
Grab a spoon and watch as it magically changes color. Then, dig into the cereal serving bowl and scoop up pieces of that color. Cross your fingers for a color flash free-for-all! Collect the most cereal pieces and you win! (From the box)

Crazy Cereal is a children's game for 2 players. Each player gets a spoon which when turned on, lights up with one of 4 colors. Players try to scoop cereal pieces in the color matching their spoon's light as it changes, one piece at a time. When a spoon starts flashing, that player gets a "free-for-all" and must scoop 2 pieces of a time in any color. Players can also scoop orange colored pieces which are only available during a "free-for-all".

The player with the most cereal pieces in their bowl when the serving bowl is empty is the winner.

215029.description:
Players lead one of six starter races in this 4X space opera, or create their own unique player made races, as they struggle for galactic control. Explore new planets, campaign for political dominance, form binding covenants, and use the might of your fleet, all while searching the cosmos for Gaia, the homeworld of an ancient creator race that will tip the balance of power.

Quest for Gaia offers limitless gameplay through technologies, discovery, player made agreements, and racial abilities! Every game is guaranteed to offer unique and fresh challenges.

During a game of Quest for Gaia, players will undergo multi-phased rounds. They will start by allocating the resources available to them from technology, planets, and government. Next, players will draw 7 cards from a communal deck, voting for who will be the galactic Chancellor (first player). Finally, starting with the first player, they will choose major actions - Explore, Campaign, Market, Covenant, Revolt, Research, Espionage, and War. The chancellor position is valuable as each of these major actions can only be taken once per round.

As each major action taken, the other players have minor actions that can be chosen - Move, Build, Upgrade, and Attack. These actions are very quick and there will be many of them, giving players something minor to do when it is not their turn.

Points are earned throughout this process and the first player to reach 18 is the winner!

215034.description:
Choosy is a set collection game featuring 100 dice.

The game starts with all the dice placed in a 10 x 10 grid. Each turn players may choose a matching pair from the outside of the grid, if they have enough dice to make a set, they may bank their set to score points.

The game continues until there are no more matching pairs of dice in the center pool. The player with the most banked dice is the winner.

215036.description: From the publisher: "NEW CCG From MediaStream Press: Spell Wars is a CCG like no other! It removes a lot of the annoyances of other games, with fast action and just enough luck and randomness to make it truly exciting! Use magic sources to put down summoning circles. Use summoning circles to draw forth minions from 7 different elements: Spirit, Air, Fire, Dark, Earth, Water, and Light. Attack and defend with your minions, using standard d6 dice. Empower your warriors with powerful buffs and enchantments. Strike down your enemies with curses and spells! Defeat your rivals with strategy, luck, and your dice-rolling skills! All you need is this book, some d6, and some counters. All the rules you need to play are included in this full-color book with 270 cards! Unlike other card games where you have to go buy pack after pack to get decent cards, they're all included here! No more tapping, no more waiting for the right card, no more watching the rich kid win because of rare cards, no more boring stats comparisons to watch monsters die... This is an innovative system with a LOT of fun updates to classic card games. Use dice to do combat, always have a hand of cards to play, and no more wasted mana and holding back. This is a SLUGFEST type battle. Check it out now!"

215037.description:
Description from the publisher:

Get Naked! is a silly card game about, well, getting naked.

The game takes about ten minutes to play, and is a fun, light diversion for three to eight players, ages six and up. The rules are simple enough to teach in sixty seconds.

The game includes a deck of twenty-two clothing cards, fifty action cards, and one instructions card.
1. By drafting from a hand of 4 cards create your ensemble of clothing cards and place them in front of you
2. Draw 3 action cards.
3. On your turn you play an action card to a card in your ensemble if you can, otherwise you need to play to an ensemble of another player. If this is impossible too, discard your hand and draw up another hand, every other player draws a card.
The actions you play are for example unbutton, rip or unzip and are corresponding to their type of clothing.
Nearly every clothing card has special abilities that are triggered through actions or events in the game. Your goal is to be the first one without an ensemble aka the first to be naked.
The art is cartoony in nature and it's by no means an adult only game.

215038.description:
In this junior edition of the card game version of Phase 10 the number cards have been replaced with animals, items and colors. Each player is given 12 phase tiles of the same back-side color and lays them out open-faced and sorted into color, animal and item tiles. Each player starts the game with four cards in hand.
In your turn you draw a card from the draw pile or the discard pile and can then, if you can make up a phase tile, lay out four cards on the table. At the end of your turn you discard a card.
To complete a phase and make up the tile you must lay out four cards with the same symbol, for instance four cards with a football, and then turn over your tile showing this symbol.
True to the name of the game the winner is the player who is first to turn over 10 of his 12 phase tiles.

215053.description:
This is an expansion for "Don't Fall in the Mead Hall" and requires that game to play. The "Allies and Drunk Guys" expansion is not needed but strongly recommended.

There are many stories in the Icelandic sagas about an undead creature called the draugr, or aptrgangr (lit. "after-goer," "again-walker," or "one who walks after death"). Most would call them zombies in this day and age and they have found the Mead Hall! Think you have what it takes to keep playing? Well go and prove your mettle once again. But this time you must fend off zombies as you out drink your Viking opponents.

You will send zombies to other tables, fight zombies, and summon zombies. Just don't fall OR get bit in the Mead Hall!

Each time you get bit the sickness at your table gets worse and you lose a heart. If you get bit when you have no hearts one of your Vikings will turn into a Zombie and stay at your table as a threat.

Also included are two zombie themed Tipsy cards that you can add to your Tipsy deck if you have the Allies expansion.

The Last table with at least one Viking standing is the winner.

name.#text: Don't Get Bit in the Mead Hall: Zombie Expansion

215054.description:
Description from the back of the box:

"There seems to be a lot going on down on the farm. The farmer accidentally left the barn door open and now the animals are all loose. With great difficulty he's managed to catch them all but now the barn is in uproar. Can you help sort the animals?

An exciting memory game with lots of animals that can also be played with as a farm set once the game is over.

Players mix up the 32 wooden animals (4 each of 8 different animals) and place them into the 8 barns. Players then take turns trying to find pairs of the animals, until all of the animals are matched. The player who found the most pairs wins.
215054.name: Gekrakeel in de stal

215056.description: A new role that replaces the Dragon. The Nightmare Unicorn will run around the board attacking and teleporting until it brings the Cave down on you. Stop it while you can.

name.#text: Vast: The Crystal Caverns – Nightmare Unicorn

215058.description:
Sonhando
Sonhando com Alice or (Dreaming with Alice) is a Dice Rolling and Set Collection game, you need to score the most victory points to win. The game is set in the Alice in Wonderland theme.

Each player rolls 6 dice and choose one of the actions in the game board. To do the action you pick all the dice for that action at once. The more dice you get better is the action.

215063.description:
Fun, fast-playing cooperative game that that reduces the fantasy RPG experience to fighting a climactic boss battle by rolling dice and playing spell cards. Comes with five characters and five sealed scenarios; stands up to replaying well.

The boss stays in an octagon in the centre, and is surrounded by eight spaces that may be occupied by players, or in higher levels fire or minions. Each turn consists of a player phase and a boss phase.

In the player phase, the player on turn rolls 4d6, and rerolls up to 2d6 once. The dice serve two functions: first, they designate through character-specific tables which actions (move, draw spell cards, heal, etc.) or spells you can take; second, the largest set of identical dice determines how much damage you do to the boss.

In the boss phase, the boss rotates either two 45° steps or to face a player. The current player rolls 3d6, discards the high die, and looks up the two lower dice in a table to determine which octants take how much damage.

215065.description:
Description from the publisher:

When Mamie leaves her cozy house, her garden becomes the battleground for a secret and terrible war between gangs of dwarves, with all of them searching for buried treasure before the owner returns home!

75 Gnom' Street is a game of investigation and bluffing, with each player trying to guess the location of the other gangs' spoils and hoping that they won't be able to find your treasures in return.

215066.description:
Description from the publisher:

When the members of the underworld start to cross the bridge that leads to their headquarters, nobody knows who will reach the other side. Dash, crash, and cash in Gang Rush Breakout — whoever meets the Godfather with the most loot wins!

215069.description:
Who Will Be The Star Of The Show?

Play as iconic characters as you challenge players to a Battle of Strength or a Battle of Wits using Shakespearean insults and the art of bluffing!

"Steal The Show!" is a race to get Five Comedy Masks. The first player to receive Five comedies, will immediately win the game; however, beware, if a player receives Five Tragedy masks, they are eliminated from the game and the remaining players continue until a winner is determined.

Each player will take on the role of a Character. Characters have unique gameplay abilities as well as a "Strength" Value (Value used in a Battle of Strength, and a "Wit" Value (value used in a Battle of Wits)

One location card is always in play and will change throughout the course of the game. Location cards modify the rules of the game.

Action Cards (Insults) are used during battle to enhance the Strength and Wit value of the character as well as insert some trickery to mix! Don't forget bluffing! Players can use bluffing techniques to assist with a numerical boost as well!

name.#text: Steal The Show! Theatrical Party Card Game

218117.description:
MNM the music battle is a Musical Trivia Game with an app, an internet connection is required to play, the app has sound effects, asks the questions and keeps the score. You get a wristband to identify your color and set your name in the app.

Your aim is to collect 1000 points, by answering questions about 4 categories of music. The big MNM 1000, 90 and nillies hits, sing your song and the big hits. You get 3 cards, one red, light blue and dark blue (which are the colors of the MNM logo) and those get recognized when pressing them on the screen. It's really easy, and works extremly well. At 300, 600 and 900 points you get to pick a new category out of the 4 aviable by showing a LP shaped cardboard to the camera. Which is always identified.

Some are just questions, somtimes you need to find a cover hidden in a ton of images, or watch a clip and tell which music it is, or bleeped words out of the clip or audio clip, so it has a good diversity and also plenty of questions so you don't get them repeated often.

So the theme is music, the aim of the game is to win and show your knowledge and the whole thing is an enjoying time with friends.

families: Guild: Game Designers of North Carolina
217886.description:
I Can't Even is a series of card games that all share one rule: The player with the highest odd score wins! For example, if the game ended with players at 9, 16, 20, and 22 points, the player with 9 points would win! Each game can be played as a standalone item or shuffled together with one or more other games in the series.

I Can't Even With These Spectacular Supers has 49 hero cards: Crusher, Dr. Chance, Ra, Reactor, Scrapper, Sensor, Vigilante, each appearing seven times.

name.#text: I Can't Even With These Spectacular Supers

215082.description:
Players in Floris collect flower cards to create bouquets — but they need to use every card in hand in order to offer that bouquet for points.

To set up, shuffle the deck, lay five cards in the shape of an X, then stack the deck nearby. On a turn, a player can either take the center card of the X, two outer cards in the X (as long as they're adjacent), or one or two face-up cards from the personal supply of an opponent. After doing this, the player either adds those cards to hand or places them face-up in their own personal supply. The player can then add any number of cards from their personal supply to their hand.

If the player can then make a bouquet of all the cards in hand and their cards contain at least five flowers, they can score if they wish. The cards must show all the same flower, or all types of flowers must be represented in equal numbers (e.g., three lilies and three roses), or at least three types of flowers in ascending numerical order (e.g., one daisy, two roses and three lilies). If the player hands in nine or more flowers, they gain bonus points in addition to one point for each flower.

When the market runs out, players score a final bouquet, then lose points for cards left in hand. Whoever has the highest score wins!

218120.description:
Description from the publisher:

After previous Data Packs have explored the game's cyberstruggles with the settings of Luna, SanSan, Mumbad, and a New Angeles wracked by economic chaos, Daedalus Complex, the first Data Pack in the Red Sand Cycle for Android: Netrunner, turns our attention to Mars. There, terraforming is already well underway, and millions of humans live alongside clones and bioroids in a handful of cities and nodes protected by transplas domes.

With sixty cards (three copies each of twenty different cards), Daedalus Complex explores the ways that life on the Red Planet is markedly different than life on Earth. On Mars, it requires a certain ruggedness to live and work. Simply traveling outside of the protected cities requires breathing assistance and protective gear. The shared hardships of survival have led to the de facto authority of the clans, and even though the Martian Colony Wars have ended, the tensions between the clans, the Martian Colonial Authority, and the corps remain high.

Mine these conflicts for change or profit with Daedalus Complex. Mars very much remains a semi-lawless frontier… and any given spark has the potential to ignite a much larger flame.

215107.description:
It's serious! The earth was hit by a flood! Everyone is flying and running away! It's true!
However, there are still birds left behind on the ground!
What are you doing! Ostrich! Penguin! Kiwi! It's true! It's true!

Each player has a balloon card indicating the pattern of his country, turning one piece per turn and tying it to the straps that comes from his favorite animal.
If all the straps are filled with balloons, that bird will fly away, to the country of the most prolific balloons!
The kiwi has special abilities. Once you acquire Mr. Kiwi, that player can go for balloons in other countries once. So the second half of the game when each player owns a kiwi, is very thrilling!
215107.name: Fly! Kiwi!

215109.description:
When Kapybara-san was playing outside, he was confused and became annoyed.
You have the tremendous ability to help him out!
Let's restore Kapybara-san!
What was the original figure like?

The game is about collecting capybara parts and
Players can take three actions.
· Moving
· Draw cards
· Use Capybara's special abilities
Please select 3 of these and act.

When Capybara returns to their original form, they will use their special special abilities to support them!
Even if you make a new creature, you only draw a special card once. Bonus points are also included.

The game ends once someone has trained six Capybara. The player with the highest score wins.
Using the capability of Capybara well disturbs other players.
Let's collect Kapybara-san sooner!

_________________________________________________________

どしーん★ぶつかってばらばらになってしまいました。

　カピバラさんたちがお外で遊んでいると
どっしーん★　ぶつかって
ばらばらになってしまいました。

そこへ通りすがったすごい能力を持ったあなた！
カピバラさんたちを元に戻してあげましょう！
あれれ？　元の姿はどんなだったのかなぁ？

概要
　バラバラになったカピバラさんたちを集めて錬成しよう！
　元の姿に戻ったカピバラさんたちの特殊能力を使ったり、新しい生き物を作ったりして、得点を競おう。
215109.name: Kapibara Barabara

215110.description:
Kingdom of Aer: King Maker is a 2-5 player elimination assassination card game set in a Florentine fantasy realm. The King of Aer has died and each of the Great 5 houses must send their Royalty to the palace to see who is most worthy to become the new King. Along the road mayhem and treachery ensues as each family plots and assassinates the potential candidates'

KOA Kingmaker is played as a simultaneous action card game. Players play 1 card each turn from their hand face down to the table. Once all players have played their card the cards are revealed and the actions of those cards are resolved with various consequences.

Eliminate your opposition until there are only two players remaining. Each card is worth a different amount of points and the player with the most points from the final two players wins the game.

215116.description:
Themed on Pixar's "Finding Dory" movie, help little Dory find her way back home by matching shells which become a path back to her parents!

Each player chooses a colored path. The shells are placed face-down on the board.

On their turn, a player chooses one face-down orange and one purple shell. If the pictures on the shell match, they are placed on the player's path. The winner is the first person to build a path to the home space.

Includes:
1 Game Board
48 Plastic orange and purple game shells
2 sticker sheets (stickers must be applied to each plastic shell)

216077.description:
"Give me five" in English.

Players move around the game board what represents different classrooms at school. There are combination of 5 dice on each classroom. Player in his turn rolls 5 dice up to 3 times and tries to get as many dice as possible from that combination.
Player gets mark for this subject according the number of dice that matches with the dice combination.
f.e. There are 4,4,5,4,3 at Geography classroom and player rolled three correct numbers: 4,6,1,5,3. He get "3" in Geography.

If everybody has all the marks the player with the highest average mark is the winner.
216077.name: Give me five

215123.description:
This Game 1 card was available to various game stores to be handed out during demos of the game.

This Spell carries the following ability:

Lose 1 [LIFE]; then gain 4 [INFLUENCE].

name.#text: Harry Potter: Hogwarts Battle – Spell: Eye of Rabbit, Harp String Hum, Turn This Water Into Rum!

218126.description:
Profiler is a game of co-operative deduction! For example, who would care more about their looks after a parachute jump? Dracula or Lady Gaga? Discuss and show that your team is the best!

Every round, one member of the team chooses a target character (e.g., Dracula) from six. They then draw two phrases from the phrase deck and ranks them from -5 to 5. The rest of the team then judges who among the six characters doesn't match up. If the team guesses correctly, the score marker is advanced one spot and the round continues. If they guess wrongly, all cards are discarded and the next round starts. The game ends after five rounds.

215126.description:
This is an expansion and requires the original game "Don't Fall in the Mead Hall."

This game includes a brand new Action Die that you may use instead of the original on your turn. It also includes a medium-sized bag so you can take the game anywhere with ease. This expansion brings in another table with 5 pawns so now you can play with a 5th player. Also included are 5 brand new Skál cards that you can add to your Skál deck (if you have it) and the optional Tipsy card deck.
In addition to the drinking, toasting and fighting of the original Don't fall in the Mead Hall, players now have a chance to sober up (passed out Vikings can wake up) by rolling the feast symbol. Every player will sober up by two (the drunk die will go down two). If you roll the turkey legs symbol your table sobers up by two and you choose another player to sober up by two. Vikings can now bring a sword and shield to the battle mat for a fight to the death. It's double the pain if you roll the new double "Skal!". Every tables drunk die will go up by two. Watch out because there's a chance Vikings at your table will get into a fight with each other if you roll the double fist. The Tipsy cards (optional, if you want to use them) add some extra mystery to each round and can make the game go faster. At the end of each round flip a Tipsy card and see if one of your Vikings can't hold his own.

The last table with at least one Viking standing wins.

name.#text: Don't fall in the Mead Hall: Allies and Drunk Guys

215127.description:
Portable Sarcophagus
Type: Armor

Traits: Light Armor, Construct

Check to Acquire: Constitution / Fortitude 6

Powers:
Display this card next to your location and shuffle your token card into your location deck to reduce all damage dealt to you to 0. When your token is returned to the location, banish this card.

If proficient with light armors, you may recharge this card and a boon that has the Magic trait when you reset your hand.

name.#text: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Mummy's Mask – "Portable Sarcophagus" Promo Card

217584.description:
From the publisher

A memorabilia and collecting game with mouse squeaky and bearish actions!

With Mauseschlau & Bärenstark It's in the nature! There the players learn local animals, flowers, tree and berry fruits. In addition, they can show how well they can represent animals and imitate animal voices. If you also show some skill in gyros and a good memory, the first to collect 6 picture cards and win

name.#text: Mauseschlau & Bärenstark Rund um die Natur

218129.description: All you need in Décrocher La Lune are a few skillfully placed ladders, a good sense of balance, and a touch of imagination. The moon waits impatiently for your arrival, but she's a sensitive lady and the smallest mistake can make her cry. The right mix of skill and luck will help you become the most agile dreamer...

215144.description:
Каркассон: Солове́й-Разбо́йник & Водяной (Solovei Razboynik and Vodyanoy) is a little expansion (2 tiles) for Carcassonne, made by the Russian editor of the Carcassonne game (Hobby World) and was a present for the participants of the Russian national Carcassonne league 2016.

One tile represents Solovei Razboynik "Nightingale the robber" from the Russian folktale "Ilja Muromez". The second tile represents Vodyanoy, a kind of ghost, only living in water.

Solovei Razboynik
If followers occupy a Road that goes through the Solovei Razboynik tile (or they occupy Roads that are connected to that tile later on in the game), players must move them onto the tile. The followers then remain on the tile until the end of the game. In his turns, instead of placing his follower, the player may return 1 follower from the Solovei Razboynik tile into his supply.

Vodyanoy
When a player places this tile adjacent to one or more tiles on the board, all followers from the adjacent tiles are moved onto the Vodyanoy tile. Followers remain on that tile till the end of the game and get 2 points minus.
215144.name: Carcassonne: Solovei Razboynik and Vodyanoy

215147.description:
Huddle Up! is a game for 2 players, ages 7+

The aim of the game is to get the most penguins in your color in a huddle, as pieces of the ice flow, they are standing on break away!

Materials
Hex Board with 37 spaces
36 pawns or cubes, 18 Black and 18 White, representing the player’s penguins

Setup
Place the board between the players.
Next starting at the top row, place a penguin one to a//////////// space, alternating Black then White while skipping the center space on the board.

Definitions
Group – Adjacent penguins of either color are considered a group and a single penguin with no adjacencies are also considered a group.

Play
One Player plays Black the other White.
Decide who starts, turns then alternate.

On a turn,
• Move a penguin away from your starting position, 3 spaces in any of the 6 directions, avoid moving over empty spaces or the center space.

• You must end your move on a space occupied by 1 or 2 penguins.

• You must move if you can, otherwise, you must pass

• No more than 3 penguins in a space.

• If you land on a space occupied by 2 penguins, and one of the 2 penguins is a friendly penguin, your opponent’s penguin is bumped off and removed from play.

If a group is split into 2 groups that is divided by empty spaces, the smaller group is removed from play.

If a group is split into two or three equal size groups, remove the group/groups that do not have the penguin that caused the split to occur.

The game ends when both players pass.

Scoring

Majority controls a space

Total the number of penguins controlling a space.

1 - Friendly Penguin on a space = 1 point
2 - Friendly Penguins on a space = 2 points
3 - Friendly Penguins on a space = 3 points

Spaces controlled by both players are not scored

Objective
Player with the most penguins in the largest connected group in his color, wins

215154.description:
Each player in Junglila is a daring explorer, progressing through the secret lands of the jungle in search of the fabled lands of the village of gold. However, the jungle is full of obstacles to overcome, and
moving forward blindly will be a fatal endeavor. With your trusty dice, you need to acquire food, wood, and a variety of tools and resources to use in your journey. You also need letters to grant you abilities along the way that allow you to change your dice, exchange artifacts, and gain various benefits. Who will be able to reach the storied village of gold and earn the most fame to become the explorer of legends?
215154.name: Junglila

215155.description:
This third installment in the Space Infantry series takes the core concept of an elite squad of veteran sci-fi soldiers fighting through random obstacles to reach an objective, using only the tools they bring with them and what they can scrounge from the environment to a new level. Main additions are co-op play, dice, and "node" cards.

The chit-based random number generation system has been replaced with physical dice. Static maps have been replaced with randomized locations on a set layout. Nodes towards a mission goal still exist but are no longer printed on the mission sheet. Instead, a deck of “node” cards are drawn and placed on an 11 x 17 map sheet as mission progresses. To further customize the experience, the “node deck” can be split into specific encounter types such as zero – g, Hazardous terrain, science facility and so on.

Space Infantry: Resurgence also brings together every module, both by LnLP and by the game’s developer, including New Worlds, Hordes mode, Steele Bones, and The Last Outpost with new components, systems, and artwork.

215156.description:
Gawi Bawi Bo is a strategy game for 2 players ages 8+

For ages 8+
30 min play time

You move and capture tiles following the Rock, Paper, Scissors rules.

Setup
Place board between the players

Shuffle the 36 tiles face down

Tiles are placed on empty spaces of the board

In turn, flip over and place a tile on an empty space, starting with the outer edge spaces. Then work your way towards the center leaving the center space empty.

You are now ready to play

Stacking Order
A Rock tile can be stacked onto a Scissor tile

A Scissor tile can be stacked onto a Paper tile

A Paper tile can be stacked onto a Rock tile

Play
Players share tiles

Play Rock, Paper, Scissors to determine the starting player

Turns then alternate

On a turn,

Move a tile from 1-3 spaces in any of the 6 directions, not over empty spaces or the center of the board. Then following the Stacking Order end the move on top of another tile capturing it.

Both tiles are removed from the board, they will be used at endgame scoring

Groups
Adjacent tiles are considered a group, a single tile with no adjacencies is also considered a group.

If a group is split into 2 groups that are divided by empty spaces, the smaller group is removed from the board.

If a group is split into 2 or 3 equal size groups, remove the group/groups that did not have the captured tile.

These tiles are not used in scoring.

When no more moves can be made the game ends

Scoring
Total your tiles using the numbers on the face of the tiles

Runs of two or more tiles only count as the lowest value in the run, like (23,24,25,26)

Subtract any (-1) tiles you may have from your total

Objective
The player with the lowest score wins!

217453.description:
For buyers at the Tokyo Game Market Dec 2016, an additional tile "Thunder" was added as a give away to create even more variety.

Rules:
The Thunder tile is flipped over and shuffled to the other 9 tiles, so the starting grid changes from a 3x3 grid to a 3-4-3 grid.
When you turn over the Thunder tile, the player to your left may randomly draw and keep one of your completed rainbow cards (unless you only own one card, or none).
If more then 3 cloud cards were flipped over, they are shuffled and put back to the other cloud cards keeping the general layout.
If 3 or less cloud cards were flipped over, these are shuffled with additional randomly chosen cloud cards in a total of 4 cards and then all put back to the general layout.

215186.description:
Unwrap special powers this holiday season! Each gift box is a special gift created for Renegade Fans.

Contents:
7 card pack for Lotus
1 promo tile for Lanterns: The Harvest Festival
1 character card for Covert
1 apothecary for Apotheca: The Secret Potion Society
1 board tile for Snow Tails
1 card for World’s Fair 1893
1 choice token for Dicey Goblins
1 card for Clank!
1 Wild Die for FUSE


Lotus: 7 Frosted Lotus Petals - Replace the 7 lotus cards from the wildflower deck with these seven frosted lotus petals. Play as normal!

Lanterns - Snowflake Tile - Remove one other random tile and replace it with this tile. Follow other regular setup rules.

Covert - Kane Character Card - Add to the available character cards. This power can only be used when drawing mission or agency cards from the regular face up options, not when taking cards from the discard.

Apotheca - Tima Apothecary Card - Use the power from the red Apothecary as if it were your own.

Snow Tails - Polar Plunge Track. 2 Sided Track Board - Dangerous Pit: Pick up your speed before the chasm! If you are going less than speed 5 when you cross the line, you will take damage! If you are going to slow, take dent cards equal to 5 minus your speed. If you end your movement in the abyss,, take any necessary dents and then don't refill your hand.
The Narrows: Follow normal rules, but be careful! This side will require some careful maneuvering!

World's Fair 1893: Alex J Kevern Promo Card - When setting up, replace one copy of George Davis with this card and follow the rules for George Davis.

Dicey Goblins - Naughty Goblin Token - When setting up, replace one of the regular goblin choice tokens with this token.

Clank - Dire Wolf Promo Card - Add this card to the Dungeon Deck when beginning the game. When it is played, count to total number of monsters that are available to fight. Add this number of Clank! and Swords to your pool for this turn.

FUSE Wild Die - Setup: Add the Wild Die to the bag with the other dice. Gameplay: If the Wild Die is rolled, it is chosen by a player just like any other die. If the # symbol is showing, the die can be placed on any space showing a number. If the color symbol is showing, the die can be placed on any space showing a color. If a space needs both a specific number AND color, the Wild Die cannot be placed there.

216090.description:
Payoff Pitch Baseball: 1940 Cards is a set of 565 cards — including players and parks — printed on high-gloss heavy cardstock for use with the Payoff Pitch Baseball base game.

L/R splits on batter cards as with all Payoff Pitch Baseball sets.

217456.description:
1+ Co-Op survival horror.

Players control survivors who wake up in the nightmarish town of Foghorn. Filled with various monsters, you must collect supplies and weapons to fight your way through the night. Can you survive until dawn? Can you escape the horrors of the town? Fight through asylums, schools, the meat factory and other horrific places as monsters hunt you. Build barricades, help other survivors for supplies. Kick doors down and fight for survival. Will you be the hunted, or the hunter?

Set in the 1980's and like a classic horror movie there are dozens of survival horror weapons to choose from but are you lucky and brave enough to find them?

Choose your survivors, each with their own strengths and weaknesses. Each with their own unique skills and starting weapon. Work alone or fight together and try to resist the madness that is slowly turning your survivor into another monster.

The game is played on a D12 (12 sided dice). Standard melee attacks are 5+ to hit but some survivors have better melee skills. Shooting is standard 5+ too. There is no shooting distance negative. Each survivor gets 5 actions for things like movement, shooting, building barricades etc. There are dozens of weapons but only 1 and some 2 of each scattered around found in crates and given by in game story survivor's on successful missions. Plus most melee weapons breaks after an 10 uses and most monsters require 3-4 hits each so stocking up is Essential. There is also limited ammo supplies to be found. You can build special weapons too like a spear if you have tape, knife and a pole cue. Most weapons and supplies are found in crates around the map. Break them open and take the said amount from the equipment card pile.
