In it, each player controls a dragon striving to diminish the other whilst bound together by the Tao; you manipulate tokens on a special board in order to activate your dragon, leaving that same board to be manipulated by your opponent on their turn.

Among customizable scenarios and increasingly profound modes, both dragons will move, attack, block each other's way and seek dominance. At the end, there can be only one... that is, at least until the tides of change come once again.
215613.name: Tao Long: O Caminho do Dragão

215614.description:
Fast-paced family game by Reiner Knizia, set in Greg Stafford's world of Glorantha. Players are khans of different fantastical tribes on the Plains of Prax, each riding a unique animal that confers special abilities. Everyone attempts to amass the biggest herd, meanwhile fighting off enemy magic, stampedes and attempts by other players to steal their cows.

Each player chooses a Khan to play, and receives a set number of corral tiles (depending on the number of players in the game). Each Khan has a different special ability. For example, the Morokanth player gets one extra Corral tile, and the High Llama player can sneak one cow card into each of their corrals after the gate has been closed.

Players take turns to raid different locations, drawing cards from 10 different stacks. Each stack contains the cards, in random order: 1 x 100, 2 x 50 and 1 x 20 Cows, a Stampede card (discard highest value cow card), an Enemy Magic card (discard all cow cards), a Tribal Champion card (protects against Enemy Magic), and a Waha's Blessing card worth 20 cows, which a player can swap for another player's Cow card.

Each players' cow cards are placed face-up in front them as their herd. Instead of drawing, on their turn a player can corral their cows. Corralled cows are safe, but each corral can only be opened once in a game. Uncorraled cows count towards the final score at the end of the game, but remain at risk of Stampedes, Enemy Magic and Waha's Blessings. Because each player has a limited number of corrals, a key element of the game is deciding when to corral them. The player with the most cows—including those in corrals and in their herd—at the end of the game is the winner and acclaimed "Khan of Khans".

215615.description:
One of the oldest board games series "Gundam", for 2 to 5 people. the SD Gundam was so popular that it became the third piece in the SD Gundam Series of the Patio. It is content, but the third task is to change the ga rats and become an RPG-like game of "to become one of five warrior gundam, to defeat the ghost that Controls SD gundam world ".

The goal of the game is to defeat the Devil. The Devil appears when you defeat the Devil's load of six places including grasslands, deserts, sea, and gravity fields. Can your warrior Gundam defeat the Devil and find peace?
215615.name: SD Gandam World 3

215616.description:
Ascension is a deck-building game in which players spend Runes to acquire more powerful cards for their deck. It offers a dynamic play experience where players have to react and adjust their strategy accordingly. Each player starts with a small deck of cards, and uses those cards to acquire more and better cards for their deck, with the goal of earning the most Honor Points by gaining cards and defeating monsters.

Ascension: Gift of the Elements is the eleventh standalone game in the Ascension series, although the game can be combined with other titles for play with up to six players. Details for the new mechanic to come soon...

215628.description:
Introduction
Man can build bridges and castles and towers. We can refine ore into wonderful tools and machines. But to truly hunt, we look not to man’s creations, but God’s - the falcon.

Use the tools and skills at your disposal to become a master falconer. Learn skills, obtain a falcon, take time to train it, then build your reputation with successful hunts.

Game Overview
Each turn the player will decide to take one of the following 5 actions:
- Go to town (to buy, sell, or barter items, work for gold, or obtain skills),
- Stay home to build items,
- Stay home to train a falcon,
- Stay home to tend to an injured falcon, or
- Attend a falconry hunt/tournament.

The player will need to balance finances (gold amount) with learning skills, training their falcons, and hunting with their falcons.

Falcon Master is played with a deck of 50 cards, plus about 25 tracking cubes in 28 turns total over 4 seasons.

36 cards are Item cards. 10 cards are Hunt Resolution cards used to determine outcomes of hunts. 4 cards are used to:
- track the turns through the 4 seasons,
- track player Gold amount, and player Reputation
- hunt
- aid in hunt resolution (reference card)

Winning
A master falconer cares for falcons, hunts them successfully for a variety of prey, and has demonstrated the skills required for falconry. To win:
- Earn 12 Reputation points,
- Successfully hunt with at least 2 different falcons, and
- Successfully hunt at least 3 types of prey: dove, Quail, Pheasant, or Duck.

Reputation points are gained by successful hunts, training your falcons, and by gaining skills important to the art of falconry (selling items built with your skills).

Falcon Master was an entry in Boardgamegeek's 2016 Mint Tin PnP Contest, and won the following:
2nd place Best Overall Design (tie)
2nd place Best Theme
2nd place Most Innovative Mechanic.

215629.description:
2 Kings is a 2 player card game played with 2 sided cards. Each card has 2 military icons (top and bottom of card) and 2 negotiation icons (left and right side of cards). The game is played in 2 phases: collecting your army, then the battle.

In part 1 of phase 1, players draw a card from the 15 card Nobles deck and place them into a diamond shaped grid to form the disputed land. In part 2, players will move their King card through the land to form allegiances with the nobles by matching icons on the sides of both cards. At the end of phase 1, each player will have their army of 5 to 7 nobles.

In phase 2, players will create 3 battle lines to battle each other. The winner is the player who wins at least 2 of the 3 battles.

2 Kings is played with 18 cards, no other components. The game is completely free of any text, no reading is required.

2 Kings is an entry in the Boardgamegeek 2016 18 card PnP Contest.

215635.description:
It is the year 1173, the Normans have invaded Ireland and King Henry II has laid claim to the island. But beyond Dublin, the old ways still rule and the ancient houses of Ireland hold sway. Take up the mantle of a young chieftain as you work to build your clan, expand your kingdom and gain the loyalty of your fellow Irish. Beyond the Pale tracks the Norman occupation and the Irish resistance over three centuries, spanning the invasion of the Bruce from Scotland, the Black Death, and the Norman retreat to their last vestige of power, the Pale of Dublin.

Beyond the Pale is played over five rounds. Each round players work to expand the influence of their clan by conquering neighboring lords, making alliances with Norman nobles and gaining the loyalty of the Irish people. The player with the largest territory and greatest loyalty at the end of the fifth round wins and is named as the High King of Ireland.

216804.description:
Description from the back of the box:

Super Mario Kart - The Card Game!

A fast running card game, players cannot reach the goal before items such as bananas and shells jam your kart and prevent victory! Mushrooms and Stars help you get in first place and achieve victory! Two game modes are included with this game! Grand Prix and Battle Mode!

In the Super Mario Kart Card Game, there are two games you can play: Grand Prix and Battle Mode.

In Grand Prix, players use numbered movement cards as well as item cards to navigate through the pack of racers from the back of the line to the front of the line. When players play movement cards, the numbers are compared to determine placement of one's kart in that round. However, players can also use item cards to assist themselves or hurt other players in their quest to win the race!

In Battle Mode, players are equipped with three balloons (like the video game) and players must manage their hand as well as anticipate the moves of other players to try and outmaneuver their attacks while landing their own. The last player with balloons is the winner!

name.#text: Super Mario Kart: The Card Game

215676.description:
A quick and easy real time dice rolling game for any number of players.

The box includes enough materials for 2 players, but more components can be added.

You'll be rolling, rerolling, and locking dice during a three-minute countdown to grill more food than your opponents.

Each player gets 6 dice with both charcoal faces and food faces. Dice can be locked on the player mat and charcoal added to "cook" that food item, which can then be scored.

212759.description:
Pyramid Arcade Loonacy is a custom edition reimplementation of Loonacy using the 22 game-specific images from Pyramid Arcade plus the main Pyramid Arcade logo for illustrations at the 72-cards card deck.

The game is a real-time card game where 2-5 players compete to get rid of all their cards by matching one of two images on each card in their hand with the images on the open piles in front of them.

The limited edition print run sold only from the Looney Labs web store. Produced while Pyramid Arcade was in print and announced at the Kickstarter page for Pyramid Arcade.

215735.description:
Book Bugs is a collectible, deck-building, card game for 2 to 4 players, created by National Library Board, Singapore.

Visitors to any of the participating public libraries can collect Book Bugs cards in three ways:
1. Borrow 8 books from the library to redeem 2 normal cards.
2. Complete a library activity to redeem 1 shiny card.
3. Attend a library programmer to redeem 1 shiny card.

A player deck is made up of 30 cards. These are put in the player's draw pile. The player's play area also has a discard pile and a playing field. Each player starts with 5 cards in his/her hand.

To determine who starts the game, each player draws a card from the top of their draw pile. The player that draws the card with the highest points starts the game.

During each turn, the player starts by playing a card on his/her playing field. The effects of the card played takes place immediately and only lasts one turn. Each player must play only 1 card per turn. The player ends his/her turn by drawing a card from his/her draw pile.

The first player to achieve a total of 20 points wins the game. Alternatively, the game ends when one player runs out of cards in his/her draw pile. All players will then have to count the total number of points from the cards on his/her playing field. The player with the highest total points wins!

218228.description: Kharnage: Tricks & Mercenaries – Army Expansion contains 18 tricks and eight mercenaries for use with the Kharnage base game.

212767.description:
Dice game with 12 dice using scoring elements from Yahtzee (with extra combinations) and Tutto (points for sets of 1's and 5's) at the same time.

Multiple scoring combinations per throw are possible, splitting the 12 dice into groups.

A bit of push your luck is also present. Players can either stop before all dice are used, scoring their total thus far or continue taking the risk to throw non-scoring dice, losing all the points of that turn.

First player to 100,000 wins.

215746.description:
Description from the designer:

Osztálytalálkozó is a nostalgic and black-humorous card game from the socialist era of Hungary, where the players are old classmates, and after a long-long time they arrive to their class reunion.

With cards everybody tells what they have archieved since their graduation in trick-taking turns. Who shows the most valuable property wins the turn, earn the points on the cards and activate a special ability of the card category (vehicle, real estate, stuff, food). Every player tries to earn as many points as he can, but everybody has an own line of limit, and if he passes that point, he lives like a bourgeois, the men of state are arriving and he is kicked out of the game. At the beginning of the game the players draw (or choose by bid in the advanced game) a job card which can help to find the best strategy and add extra abilities to the players.

Osztálytalálkozó is a fast-placed card game with the base of trick-taking games, but it adds not only the special abilities on the property cards and the characters but the line of limit. It has been drawn by the socialist state, and it is an other rule what twists the well-known mechanisms.

215749.description:
The Dawnspire stands at the edge of the Transient Isles. Immense, drifting islands of black stone hanging in the air above an azure sea, they were once the subject of foul sorceries, a powerful Chaos wizard seeking to bring them crashing down. The mages of the Eldritch Council were able to stop this foul ritual, but not before two of the islands were lost to the depths.

To protect the isles, the Dawnspire was created; housing objects of incredible power, it is protected by the most elite warriors the Transient Isles have ever known. Yet cruel eyes glow in the corners of the realms. fixated on the Dawnspire, intent on harnessing its power for their own dark purpose…

Dawnspire is a fantastic box set filled with Citadel miniatures, with a book telling the story of the Skaven Warlord Ripsnikk’s attempt to take the Dawnspire from the Swifthawk Agents who protect it. 74 miniatures are included, split between Skaven and Aelf forces:

Aelf:

- 1 High Warden
- 1 Archmage
- 10 Swordmasters
- 10 Spireguard
- 5 Reavers

Skaven

- 1 Skaven Warlord
- 1 Warlock Engineer
- 1 Packmaster
- 2 units of 20 Clanrats
- 2 Rat Ogors
- 1 Poisoned Wind Mortar Weapon Team
- 1 Warpfire Thrower Weapon Team

The box also includes the complete rules for playing games of Warhammer Age of Sigmar, 2 Warscroll Battalions and 2 Pitched Battle Profiles, one of each for each force. Supplied with round and square bases for each model.

name.#text: Warhammer: Age of Sigmar – Spire of Dawn

212769.description: 2 to 4 players compete to build strong orchestras and earn reputation points by playing concert pieces successfully. The game requires players to balance the need to strengthen different sections of their orchestra with the desire to score points. Concert music pieces reflect difficulty levels required to play successfully. Card drafting and hand management are the primary mechanics in this game.

215755.description:
1 versus 1 tactical combat game played on an 8x8 to 12x12 square grid game board. Each side has 6 military units, plus a Fortress to defend, and a Cannon Turret to defend the Fortress.

Set up your units on your edge of the board, then let the battle begin. Each player's turn is made up of 2 actions: Move, Attack, Heal an injured unit, or Repair and disabled vehicle.

Attacks are resolved by comparing Attack Strength + dice roll to Defense Strength + dice roll. Defending units may be destroyed, disabled, or sustain no damage.

A player wins the game by destroying their opponent's Fortress or all of their opponent's army.

Iron Infantry was an entry in the 2015 Mint Tin PnP design Contest.

Iron Infantry is a mini game based on the steam punk inspired game "Iron & Brass".

All that's needed to play is the 8 units per player, 2D3 (1,1,2,2,3,3) dice per player and a checker or chess board, or any other 8x8 to 12x12 square grid board.

215757.description:
Each player starts with 14 soldiers and 1 ensign on the 15 spaces between two castles. Movement is one space in any direction. The river can only be crossed on the three bridges. Enemy pieces can be captured by jumping over the piece onto an empty space behind it. Capturing is alowed in any direction but backwards. To win the game one has to capture the enemy ensign or move one's own ensign onto one of the enemy's starting spaces.

On the backside of the game board, there is an "Nine Men's Morris" board.
215757.name: Fahnen-Spiel

215760.description:
Included in all KS boxes, but will be available separately.

Discard card from your hand to earn 3 beers or 3 golds.

name.#text: Vikings Gone Wild: Sif Promo Card

215773.description:
Plan 1919 is a two-player game exploring the most influential campaign that never was: J.F.C. Fuller's revolutionary plan to use new tank technology to penetrate past the frontlines, forgoing the brutal stalemate of "body warfare" to take out German lines of communication via a "shot through the brain". The 1918 armistice rendered the plan moot, and it was derided by the more traditionalist elements of the British Army. But others were paying attention, and the Second World War saw Fuller's vision realized with terrifying effect by Nazi Germany.

The Allied Player is on the attack, with many tank brigades at his disposal - but will they be enough? The Germans of this era have few armor units, but can utilize anti-tank units and aircraft to mount a stubborn defense. It's in their interest to prevent and minimize Allied advances while maintaining their tenuous lines of supply and communication.

Units represent corps, divisions, and brigades, moving across hexes that are about seven miles across. The time scale of individual turns is fungible and dependent on tempo, but the entire twenty-turn campaign represents about two months of real-world fighting.

Designer John Gorkowski is no stranger to the Great War, having designed a number of games on the topic at tactical, operational, and strategic scales. When Hollandspiele decided it wanted to publish a game on the subject, Mr. Gorkowski was the first and only designer we had in mind, and his experience with gaming the era results in a plausible, believable, playable version of Fuller's what-if.

name.#text: Plan 1919: Fuller's Plan to End the Great War

218455.description:
Description from the publisher:

You are a legendary time traveler on a mission to collect both ancient artifacts and futuristic gizmos. You've got all the time in the world, so which part of history will you raid first? Do you race chariots in the Roman Empire or outwit Ben Franklin during the American Revolution? Should you face off against a futuristic robot or try to capture a prehistoric dinosaur?

The choice is yours in Time Raiders, a time-twisting Cardventure — just be careful not to alter history too much before you make it back to the present!

215795.description:
"Out of curiosity... Amelio Gonzolez... stuck a flaming candle... in the protruding ear of... Maria Sanchez... and smiled wickedly."

Uncover an act most cruel by revealing six story elements that together describe the treachery and spell the word UNKIND.

Careful though, your opponents are equally devilish, so you'll need to use your letters, corvid tokens, and perhaps summon a black raven to stop them. 2 to 5 players and plays in about 20 minutes.

The Corvid Tokens can also be used to expand your options and deepen your strategy in Murder of Crows.

OBJECTIVE:
Be the first player to spell the word UNKIND in front of you and then read the Act Most Cruel along the bottom of the cards aloud to win.

PLAY:
On your turn you draw 1 card and play 1 card in front of you in order to spell the word UNKIND.

When played, a card's ability is activated:

Undo: Pick a player, they must return the last card they played into their Unkind to their hand.
Need: Draw 1 card and 1 corvid.
Kill: Remove one letter from an opponent’s UNKIND
Investigate: Draw 2 corvid Tokens, then look at a player's hand.
Drag: Collect 1 corvid Token from another player.




Alternatively, a player can acquire a Corvid Token:

When casting a spell, a player may instead draw a corvid token. Spell does not occur.
When drawing a card, a player may instead draw a corvid token.




Countering Card Abilities:
When a card is played, another player may prevent its effect from affecting them (alone) by discarding a card from their hand. The discarded card must have the same number of Crows in the top left corner as the card played.

Using Corvid Tokens

When playing a letter card, a player may spend corvid token(s), to increase the crow value of the card by 1 crow per token.
When countering a spell, a player may spend corvid token(s), to increase or decrease the crow value of the card by 1 crow per token.
Before ending their turn, a player may place corvid token(s) on any empty letter spot(s) in another player’s UNKIND. Players may add to spots with corvid token(s), but no letter spot may every contain more than 5 corvid token.




Corvid Tokens in your Murder

When there is one or more corvid tokens in your murder, you may only play a letter card into that spot if you over come the total number of Birds in the spot. The player can do this with just a letter card, or it may require additional crows added to the card (An empty spot with 5 corvid tokens, could be removed with a 3 Crow Letter card and 3 corvid tokens). Once overcome, all the corvid tokens are removed.
A Wild Crow/Raven card may be placed in a empty spot regardless of corvid tokens. The corvid tokens are all removed.




Wild Ravens Cards
In Unkindness of Ravens, each Raven card has a unique ability written on the card.

215796.description:
Description from the publisher:
"Would you dumpster hump a robot, eat the dingleberries of a coked-out unicorn, and joust Tarzan? Or, maybe you would hump the unicorn, joust the robot, and snack on Tarzan's dingleberries?!

Spank the Yeti is inspired by the popular parlor game, F*ck, Marry, Kill. Each round, one player pairs up three Action Cards with three Object Cards (people, creatures, and things), and the other players try to correctly predict his or her answers. You don’t really know your friends until you know whose dingleberries they'd eat."

name.#text: Spank the Yeti: The Adult Party Game of Questionable Decisions

215798.description:
The Christmas tree is a décor token.

You may place it in a room consisting of two or three cards (not including the garage). You can have only one Christmas tree in your home. The standard décor rules apply otherwise.

To get a Christmas tree, after you take the pair of cards from the column of your choice, discard the resource card and replace it with the available Christmas tree token with the most points.
215798.name: Domek: Żeton Promocyjny - Choinka

215800.description:
Rob Markham returns with 12 Battles from the Age of Chivalry. Using his famous R&R system, updated and modified for these battles. The battles included are:

Hastings
Lincoln
Bouvines
Marchfield
Stamford Bridge
Kalaura
Bannockburn
Lake Peipus
Legnano
Leignitz
Virkov
Brunkeberg

Of medium complexity, rated a 4 on a scale of 1 to 10, 10 being hardest, the game is well suited to solitaire play. Recommended for ages 12 and above.

Projected Contents:
12x 22x17 full-color maps
6x full-color, die-cut, counter sheets of half-inch counters
1x Rules Booklets
1x Scenario Booklet
Charts and Tables
Dice

name.#text: Battles from the Age of Chivalry

215801.description:
Lore.
...Your Shieldbearer falls, shield broken and stomach pierced by the Sword of the opposing champion. You move your Archer into the frontline – Encouraged by your Priestess, he shoots an arrow at the Magician, covered against melee attacks. With an arrow in his chest, he falls. You watch as the Warlord frowns at the result. The loss of his Magician was not part of his plan. Desperately, he orders his Conqueror to battle to face your Monk

With an empowered, overwhelming strike your Monk puts the Conqueror in the grave, exposing the opposing strategist. Rising to the occasion enters your Champion. He charges the Strategist and with a single swing of his sword the Strategist – The Savages only hope – is decapitated, securing your victory. Icosara is yours.

Game Concept
Edge Is a tabletop card game where two players wage war on each other using cards, dices and tactical formations. The game has a heavy emphasis on strategy and calculated tactics and plays both like a boardgame and a living card game.

It is very easy to get into the game and the rules seem almost simple, but don't let that fool you. The more you get play it, the more advanced formations you and your opponent will come up with.
Through different tactics and different setups, you will delve into the over 14.000 different ways to set up your army.

Though playing it gives a similar vibe, Edge is not Magic or even a rework of the game. No more arguing about obscure rules or different versions of the same. This game combines elements and inspiration from multiple games, that most gamers will recognize, but the mechanics are utilized in such a way that the game forms it's own new genre.

So choose your tactics and strategy!
How will you choose to play and how will you ensure victory? Do you want to charge at your opponent with brute force, or do you want to slowly lure him into your traps to weaken him before the deathblow. The choice is yours.

Goal of the Game
Most points win!
So in the normal game you will need to accumulate more points then your opponent in a 2 matchs/battles setup.
There are variants but even for those most points win

Resources
This game as stated in the game concept, is about resources. your card/pawns, dices, re-rolls and everything else is a limited resource and you will need to think about when and when not to use them or you will quickly find yourself with any way to protect your army and lose.

215803.description:
User summary
パナマ (Panama) is a investment card game for 4 players only, which uses a deck of traditional playing cards and 20 card stands made with a 3D printer. The rules are available in Japanese and English. (In Japan, the standard deck of Western playing cards is known as a 'Trump' deck. Hence the designer explaining the game as a 'Trump Extension' game.)

Cards numbered A, 2, 3, 4, 5, and two jokers are investment cards. Five cards each are dealt to the players. Cards numbered 6-10 are tax haven cards. Players try to earn positive tax haven cards by playing investing cards.

When you invest on a tax haven card, you place a card stand along a border of the tax haven card and insert an investment card you want to play, so that one player cannot see how much you invest. Up to four players can invest on a tax haven card, and the highest investor earns the face value of that tax haven card. But one pre-determined suit counts negative, and a joker also inverts the sign if involved. You should speculate about hidden cards and try to let negative points go to other investors.

You can co-operate with one of other players by sharing complete information about what you play. But to win the game, you have to part ways in the end.

Jacks, Queens, and King are agent card. Each player has one of these at the beginning of a game, and can use it once for one shot effect, such as reversing order or skipping a player.

Publisher's summary
トランプ拡張ゲーム「パナマ」

トランプ(Playing Card)を
・投資カード　・タックスヘイブンカード　・工作員カード
に分け、場に出されたタックスヘイブンカードの周囲を
投資カードを付属のカードスタンドで立てていき、点数を稼いでいきます。
情報漏洩事務所(Panama paper office)への投資は減点となるため、他人におしつけます。
トランプを立てて置くと、４人の内１人からは必ず絵柄が見えなくなるため
プレイヤーは常に誰を騙すか選択することになります。
協調することで点は増えますが、最終的には出し抜いて１位を目指します。

215806.description:
In IKAN, one of the players uses tiles to create a 5x5 labyrinth, with the labyrinth having an opening where the hero enters, a treasure, a monster, and some items that the hero needs to find. The other players watch the labyrinth being built and have a few seconds after it's finished to memorize everything, then the labyrinth is hidden from view. The dungeon maker starts a timer, then the players try to move their hero through the labyrinth by giving directions: "Go straight, turn left, go straight again." "Okay, you just picked up the key." "Now we turn around..."

The players must locate the treasure, pick up a weapon and slay the monster, then escape from the labyrinth without running out of time.

215807.description:
Zagor: Odissea Americana: Trampy Promo Card is one of a set of 4 event cards to be added to those in the Zagor: Odissea Americana base game. The cards are simply shuffled in with the base game cards, adding more variety from game to game.

The first 3 italian versions of the cards (Molti occhi, Trampy and Icaro La Plume) were given to the visitors of Lucca Comics & Games 2016, a comics & gameplay festival in Lucca in 2016, and later during other promotional events with the 4th card (Insidie sul fiume). It's one of the first additional cards for the Italian edition of Zagor: Odissea Americana.

Text:

Trampy
Cico non tira dadi azione. Nota: Sacrifica un dado azione giocatore
Cico does not roll any action die. Note: Sacrifice one action player die

name.#text: Zagor: Odissea Americana – Trampy Promo Card

215808.description:
Zagor: Odissea Americana: Icaro La Plume Promo Card is one of a set of 4 event cards to be added to those in the Zagor: Odissea Americana base game. The cards are simply shuffled in with the base game cards, adding more variety from game to game.

The first 3 italian versions of the cards (Molti occhi, Trampy and Icaro La Plume) were given to the visitors of Lucca Comics & Games 2016, a comics & gameplay festival in Lucca in 2016, and later during other promotional events with the 4th card (Insidie sul fiume). It's one of the first additional cards for the Italian edition of Zagor: Odissea Americana.

Text:

Icaro La Plume
Quando entra in gioco, Icaro La Plume viene preso dal timoniere. Puoi associarlo a un movimento per spostarti in qualunque spazio. Dopo averlo usato, passa Icaro La Plume a un altro giocatore. Nota: Questo evento non può essere scartato
When it comes into play, Icarus La Plume is taken by the helmsman. You can associate it with a movement to move in any space. After using it, pass Icarus La Plume to another player. Note: This event can not be discarded

name.#text: Zagor: Odissea Americana – Icaro La Plume Promo Card

215813.description:
Zagor: Odissea Americana: Insidie sul fiume Promo Card is one of a set of 4 event cards to be added to those in the Zagor: Odissea Americana base game. The cards are simply shuffled in with the base game cards, adding more variety from game to game.

The first 3 italian versions of the cards (Molti occhi, Trampy and Icaro La Plume) were given to the visitors of Lucca Comics & Games 2016, a comics & gameplay festival in Lucca in 2016, and later during other promotional events with this card (Insidie sul fiume). It's one of the first additional cards for the Italian edition of Zagor: Odissea Americana.

Text:

Insidie sul fiume / Perils on the river
Scopri i pericoli dietro il battello. Ogni giocatore può pagare un gettone (simbolo) per scartare un pericolo. Se restano almeno:
due eventi: rimuovi segnalino scafo (simbolo) più a destra
una pianta carnivora: il battello subisce danno (simbolo) pari alla velocità attuale
una rapida: avanza il battello di uno spazio e svuota la cambusa
Find out the dangers behind the boat. Each player can pay a token (symbol) to discard a danger. If there are at least:
two events: remove the rightmost hull marker (symbol)
a carnivorous plant: the boat takes damage (symbol) equal to the current speed
rapids: the boat moves forward one space and empties caboose

name.#text: Zagor: Odissea Americana – Insidie sul fiume Promo Card

215817.description: Catacombs & Castles: Siege Defender contains the stretch goals from the Catacombs & Castles Kickstarter campaign, and its first edition is effectively a backer-exclusive expansion, offering a number of new heroes, lords, minions, and abilities.

215818.description: Keystones & Keeps is an expansion for Catacombs & Castles, which provides a pitted board (with configurable pits: there are 6 different types), and a number of heroes for both teams.

215820.description:
This Game 3 card was available to various game stores to be handed out during demos of the game.

This Ally carries the following ability:

Choose one:
Gain 2 [INFLUENCE] or All Heroes gain 1 [LIFE]

name.#text: Harry Potter: Hogwarts Battle – Ally: Seamus Finnigan

215821.description:
The Mare Nostrum: Empires - Mythical Beasts Expansion Tiles are fully compatible with Mare Nostrum – Empires. These creatures feature new additions, such as:


The Kraken, which can help defend your triremes with floating Sea Fortresses.
The Sphinx, who provides her wisdom in the Trade round, allowing you to choose your Resources after you see what your opponents have to offer.
The Hydra, which attacks both foes and friends indiscriminately in battle.
The Manticore, which reduces your opponent's Legions, even as it bolsters your military strength.
The Mermaid, who guides your triremes, allowing them to move one additional Sea Area per turn.

name.#text: Mare Nostrum: Empires - Mythical Beasts Expansion Tiles

215822.description:
This Game 1 card was handed out during GenCon 2016 and BGG.Con 2016.

This Spell carries the following ability:

Lose 1 [LIFE]; then draw two cards.

name.#text: Harry Potter: Hogwarts Battle – Spell: Sunshine Daisy, Butter Mellow, Turn This Stupid Fat Rat Yellow!

215823.description:
Smash the piggy bank (Tireli'Cochon) and pick the treasure!

Spin the arrow and discover the action to be done: insert a coin in Tireli'Cochon, pull its tail or try to break it by beating it down with a hammer on its helmet! When the piggy bank explodes, run after the coins and try to pick up a maximum!

Casse la tirelire et récupère le trésor !

Tourne la flèche et découvre l’action à accomplir : glisse une pièce dans Tireli’Cochon, tire lui la queue ou essaye de le casser en tapant sur son casque ! Quand ta tirelire explose, cours après les pièces et essaye d’en ramasser un maximum !

215828.description: Age of Steam Expansion: Ice Pack & Solar System features two maps for 3-5 players. Solar System is particularly hard to master as the city-planets revolve around the Sun, while in Ice Pack the map disappears round after round.

name.#text: Age of Steam Expansion: Ice Pack & Solar System

215829.description: Age of Steam Expansion: Cuba & Sicily has two new maps, with a new "Gunpowder" special action delivery to recognize the revolution in Cuba, which is a solitaire map. In the two-player map Sicily, the players struggle against the Cosa Nostra, a third virtual player.

name.#text: Age of Steam Expansion: Cuba & Sicily

215840.description:
The castle is the highlight of the hike, but hardly have the hikers entered the old walls, when the squeaky doors close. Escape appears impossible — but strange hints may lead players in a new direction. Can they solve the riddles and find the way to freedom?

EXIT – Das Spiel: Die verbotene Burg is a puzzle game modeled after escape rooms.

name.#text: EXIT – Das Spiel: Die verbotene Burg

215841.description:
For those shipwrecked on the beach of this forgotten island, a chained boat is the only hope — but the mysterious owner has left puzzles over the whole island. Will the team solve them, free the boat, and escape?

EXIT – Das Spiel: Die vergessene Insel is a puzzle game modeled after escape rooms.

name.#text: EXIT – Das Spiel: Die vergessene Insel

215842.description:
An alarm sounded in the eternal ice, so the polar station has been evacuated and foreclosed, but a small group of researchers has remained behind by mistake — and they have only one hour to find the code that will crack the lock program.

EXIT – Das Spiel: Die Station im ewigen Eis is a puzzle game modeled after escape rooms.

name.#text: EXIT – Das Spiel: Die Station im ewigen Eis

211747.description:
Jumbalup plays with words, syllables and sounds, and combines observation, memory and strategy with a bit of luck.

Make strange and fantastic creatures in a race to complete your animals first. The winner is the first player to collect four real animals with matching heads and tails.

Players take turns to draw a card adding a head or tail to their collection or saving a special card to play later - using a Jumbalup card to steal a head or a tail from another player or playing a dodo to slow another player down.

The cards can also be used to play a matching pairs memory game (with twists) for younger players (3+).

A pack of Jumbalup contains 56 standard sized playing cards and a printed rule sheet.

217564.description:
Description from the publisher:

Nibbled is a fast-paced, easy-to-learn game that starts with kids clipping four plastic fish onto themselves. Guess a color, then flip a card. Guess correctly, and you unclip one fish and clip it onto an opponent. Whoever first unclips all of their fish wins!

215850.description: A pre-order bonus for Phalanxx, adding an extra expert starting card. The card gives you an additional, fourth, white "1" die that helps you fulfill card requirements.

211767.description: A card game for mature audiences. Players take turns playing cards on themselves or an opponent to affect their scores in Money, Health and Dilation points. The first player who is broke, dead and f*cked wins the game.

215870.description:
Description from the publisher:

A new concept in word games with the great advantage of involving all the players in the fun of the game all of the time. The game can be played by the whole family & by any number of players. The game centers around the planners or plans. These are the 'Crosswords' made up by all the players before the play actually begins. These planners are filled out by each player in crossword fashion on a particular theme or subject e.g. Film Stars, The Sea, Sport etc & the rest of the players have to find the words in these plans - the player with the most points being the winner. A game concept that can grow & even use tiles from other word games !

215873.description:
B. - The novel is almost ready, missing only the finale.
J. - Right, it could take place in front of the gates of the Black Land.
H. - Black Land, John? We are in New England!
J. - You are killing the epic poetry Howard, Black Land and a horde of orcs.
B. - I got it! We can set the Novel in Transylvania, it's a classic! And a lot of garlic, everywhere.
H. - We already chose the United States.
B. - Romania or nothing!
J. - Middl ...
DLIN DLON!!
E. - I'm Poe, I solve problems!

This card is kept on the Idea Area and is available to players like other cards, but it can only be activated, not gathered. When a player activates the card, Discussion action starts: the player must propose a new card to substitute a Novel card. All players can join the decision assigning their strength to change it or not.

name.#text: The Vampire, the Elf & the Cthulhu: Edgar Allan Poe

211785.description:
Springo is a classic roll-and-move game in which players race with their pawns to the middle of the board.

Each player controls 4 pawns. At the beginning of the game each pawn is on the outer ring. The goal of the game is to move the pawns to the inner rings and finally to the middle. Every turn a player throw a dice and choose which pawn to move clockwise around the circle that the pawns is currently. If the pawn ens its move in the same place as the other pawn, the other one goes back to the starting place. If a pawn finishes a move in a horse spot, then the next move that pawn will do is going to the inner circle. If it is the most inner circle then that pawn finishes his game in one of the six spots in the middle of the board.

When there are six spots in the middle occupied the game is over. The player that lead the most pawns to the middle is the winner. In case of a tie the values that pawns are standing on in the middle are sum up and whoever has the most is the winner.

211787.description:
A Black Stories edition with riddle stories from science fiction movies and series.

Black Stories are tricky, morbid, sinister riddlestories. The
players try to reconstruct the particulars of each incident,
piece by piece, by asking yes-or-no-questions.

215884.description:
In the Batman Miniatures Game there are a couple of different versions of Bane to run your crew.

Arkham Origins Bane is a skilled fighter and a skilled planner. A danger to anyone that gets too close to him.

This Bane is often followed by a team of Mercenaries. These Mercs are well trained and very well armed. Bringing a selection of weaponry, they are all Veteran combatants and each also wears a Bulletproof Vest for protection.

This set contains four new miniatures and their associated character cards. Now you can build an army of mercenaries for the Batman Miniature Game.

211790.description: A single card and solo rules given for free at Essen 2016

215887.description:
Object. Buy Sell! "Pass GO and Collect $200!" Or"Go directly to Jail!" All the fun and excitement of Parker Brothers classic real estate trading game is here in this University of Michigan Edition. Buy famous alumni and coaches, utility companies, and properties of all types including President Gerald Ford and Coach Bo Schembechler. Increase the value of your properties by adding houses and hotels. Amass the greatest fortune in money and property and you're the winner!

Equipment. Game board 10 tokens Title Deed cards Package of playing money Chance cards. Community Chest cards Package of houses Package of hotels. A pair of dice

211792.description: Variant of the game with 6 Pillars offers for the first edition of the game at Essen 2016
211792.name: Kolumny z Delf

211803.description:
A Major League Baseball simulation game, which has individual cards for each player and a set of result charts for each of 8 base situations (bases empty to bases loaded), rare plays, base stealing, base advancement, advanced pitching grades.

After setting your lineup, players roll dice, obtain a result number from the player card, and then refer to charts for results. This will result in an out, or getting on base, with details about each outcome. Then you move on to the next batter. Standard rules of major league baseball apply.

Although the cards are designed for play with all APBA game boards, it's highly recommended that you purchase the SkeeterSoft Boards and Advanced Pitching System. All options in the SkeeterSoft world are intuitive, fully explained on the lineup sheet and an Options sheet furnished with each set, and have a relatively slight learning curve.

Almost every season is available back to 1901.

211805.description:
Notorious is a strategic dice drafting, resource management, set collection game. You'll draft new crew members and complete heists to earn the most Notoriety points to win the game.

You started as a small-time hood. But you know to become king of this city, you’ll need a crew. Assemble the right team, complete heists, and gain notoriety. As you finish more jobs, the heat on you becomes stronger. If one of your squad gets pinched, you can always work the system with a bribe, or just let them go to the slammer. Outlast your rivals and see if you have what it takes to become the most NOTORIOUS.

Gameplay:
As a new boss, you will complete small jobs by rolling dice. You’ll use the earnings (jewels) from these small jobs to buy new members to join your crew. These Crew members will combine their abilities together to allow you to complete larger Heists. Every Heist you complete will earn you Notoriety points to win the game.

On your turn, you can do any 2 of the following:
1. Roll dice (completing small jobs)
2. Draft up to 2 crew cards
3. Complete up to 2 heists

Rolling Dice - If you roll dice, you roll your choice of 2 of the 3 colored dice (red, blue, and green), and roll 1 of the 2 black and white dice. You can keep and/or re-roll any of the dice once, so that’s a total of 2 total rolls.

Dice representation: Blue die = Sapphires. Green die = Emeralds. Red die = Rubies. The diamond shape represents a Diamond. The Flame shape represents Surveillance. The Star on the Black die represents the player earning a Jewel of the player’s choice.

Drafting Crew Cards – The cost of the Crew Card is detailed in the upper left portion of the card. You can pay the jewel cost (earned from rolling dice), and that crew member is now part of your crew. You will play that Crew Card on the table in front of you. A new Crew Card replaces the drafted Crew Card on the table. - Each crew member has attributes which will help players complete Heists. Some crew members have special abilities which will improve your abilities, or hinder the play of your competitors.

Completing Heists – If you have enough attributes from your collective Crew Cards, you may complete the Heists. The Heist requirements are detailed at the bottom of the Heist Card. You will add your Crew Card attributes together, and if those attributes total to at least the minimum required for each Heist requirement, you may complete the Heist. You will take the Heist card and keep it on the table in front of you. A new Heist Card is placed face up on the table to replace any Heist Card taken by a player. Each Heist Card has a Notoriety point value at the top right. The first player to earn at least 21 Notoriety points wins the game.

211806.description:
To Windward!: The Lunar Islands is a 2-4 person competitive, historical Euro-style tabletop game inspired by the Golden Age of Sailing.

It is a competitive, strategic tabletop game which realistically captures the excitement, danger and unpredictability of life at sea. Players command their own fleet of ships in an effort to establish themselves as the dominant naval power in the Lunar Islands. The scales of power can shift suddenly all with a change of wind or an enemy's skills as a master gunner, skilled sailor, or clever scoundrel.


How to play


Set up

Each player gets a Home Island a sturdy Sloop to begin their quest for adventure and riches and the race to gain the most Power & Influence over the islands.


Player turn


1- Check Wind

Check wind timer and reset wind direction if necessary.


2- Perform actions

During their turn a player gets 4 actions.


Sail up to 2 steps leeward or straight to leeward
Sail 1 step to windward (may not sail straight to windward)
Use Gunnery card
Use a Sailing card
Dock/Go to town
Upgrade a ship
Buy a new sloop
Relaunch a sunken ship
Dive for sunken treasure
Buy up to three cards (Sailing and/or Gunnery) for 2 gold each
Buy 1 Power and Influence token for 8 gold (once per turn, not allowed during final round)



3- Collect Power and Influence tokens & claim accomplished Missions


+1 Selling cargo for 2 gold per ton during a docking action
+1 Buy Power and Influence for 8 gold (not allowed during final round)
Sink an enemy ship
+2 for a Sloop
+3 for a Frigate/Barque
+4 for a Indiaman/Man o' War



All awards doubled during final round


4- Draw and carry out 1 Event card


The Wind

The wind can be an unpredictable ally or fierce opponent. It dictates how far and which directions ships can sail and a change in the wind change quickly shift the balance of power.


Sailing & Fighting

A players hand consists of Sailing and Gunnery cards which are used then discarded to move across the board with ease, to attack other players ships or perhaps fend off an opponent. The diversity and strength of these two decks can turn vulnerable seeming Sloop into a fierce or wily opponent.


Trading

By filling a ship's hold with one of 3 commodities in the game and trading it to the neighbouring islands, players can begin to amass gold and gain Power & Influence.


Upgrades

This gold can be used to add ships to their fleet or upgrade their Sloop or Sloops to be fierce fighting ships like Frigates and Man o' War or rich merchant vessels like Barques and the famous Indiaman and take on enemies to win Power. But be careful, as a ship becomes laden with treasure, it will become targets for other players.


Events

Events add another wrinkle of unpredictability in the game. At the end of each players turn a random event occurs which may effect their fleet, or the entire board with positive or perhaps disastrous consequences.


Missions

Missions set out tasks that players can accomplish during their turn for a significant payout. Be sure to store as much treasure on your home island as possible because treasure still on a ship at the end of the game only counts for half of what gold on shore is worth.


End Game

In the final round the stakes are raised as the race to get the most Power & Influence over the Lunar Islands nears an end. Players who have thought strategically and planned can turn this to their advantage and sweep victory out from under their opponents.


Victory


End of game awards


+1 for each Sloop in your fleet
+2 for each Frigate/Barque in your fleet
+3 for each Indiaman/Man o' War in your fleet
+1 for first Mission, +2 for second, +3 for third, etc.
+1 for every 10 treasure


At the end of the game the player with the most Power and Influence wins. In case of a tie whoever has the most treasure is the victor

211807.description:
This is a murder mystery party game for 8-14 guests.

Setting / Theme:
This annual party banquet takes place at Gonagen Trailer Trash Park, where the residents have gathered to guzzle beer and box wine, and chomp down vittles while they celebrate nothing in particular "just a good ole time for all of us to get together," says Big Hoss Beaver, the host. However, this year the event was dampened by the unforeseen murder of one of the residents! Who, at this totally unfashionable party, created this trailer trash tragedy? All guests will have fun playing out their individual characters and investigating this unpredictable event. Whodunit and why, are the mysteries the rest of the trailer folks are determined to solve before the murderer strikes again!

The Gonagen Trailer Trash Park is the setting for this murder mystery game for 8-14 player guests. All of the residents come together to celebrate this grand event, the Annual Trailer Park Smorgasbord Dinner and Dance party. However,the party is overshadowed by the murder of one of the residents!

How to Play
Planning:

Host of the Murder Mystery picks the day/time and location for the game which will take 2-3 hours and finds out how many guests can attend.
Host creates guest list and assigns each guest one of the characters to play.
Host sends official invite with their character background to each guest.
Guests create / purchase a costume based on their character. Thrift stores are good for this.
Host decorates and plans for food for evening.




Playing the game:

As guests arrive, the host gives them their instructions for the first round which will include things to say/do/ask.
After all actions are completed, instructions are given to guests for Round 2.
Repeat again for Round 3.
In between rounds you can eat or have activities based on the theme.




Ending:

Everyone discusses and says who they think the murderer is.
Each guest reads their final clue in order leading up to the murderer.
Winner are those that guessed the murderer.
If nobody guesses correctly the murderer wins.

211808.description:
We are Orcs! We come to rob you, see your houses burn down and blow your heads off!
We're done being victims of your heroes in tights and shining armor!
In this world, we are the heroes!
So hang on, you are about to embody a gang of green skins! Be quick, ruthless and sly.
In "OrcQuest", being mean is good.
Brawls, traps, treasures, captures and cheap shots are on the menu, and you're gonna love it!
"OrcQuest" is a fast paced and fun card game where violence and dirty tricks are the keys to victory. Even our dice are sharp enough to slash our enemies.
Be bad, be strong, be Orc!

"Orcquest, The Card Game" is a card game with dice and tokens.

The Goal : Be the richest green skin alive at the end of the raid.

Every turn, you take a card from the draw pile. Then you have to play one challenge card (Brawl, Trap or Capture). You can also play other cards: one Magic stuff, one Treasure, and as many Cheapshot as you want to help you.
The dice will determine the result of the challenge.
If you succeed, you get the reward (gold, life points...)
If you failed, you can lose life points, gains, cards... and maybe you will not be alone.
Every player can interact during the turn of the others, using Cheapshots or Magic stuff.
When there is no more card in the draw pile, a last turn is played. This is the final phase. Some cards can only be played at this moment, if you manage to keep them in your hand...

211810.description:
Sweets Stack is a competitive puzzle game in which your goal is to overfill your opponent's candy buckets first while cleverly placing candies into your bucket to prevent it from overflowing.

Each round you start with a new candy bucket sheet. Players will pass around candy cards, and each player must mark the shape of the candy they receive in their candy bucket sheet. If you plan well and stuff your candies efficiently, you will be able to put many candies in your bucket. Each candy you successfully put in your bucket scores you points.

After three rounds, each player adds up their total score, and the player with the highest score wins!

211811.description:
Description from the rules:

The year is 1400 BCE. The fabled Labyrinth of Konoso, better known as the Labyrinth of Knossos, has suffered a catastrophe! Parts have been burned, other bits have collapsed, making it nearly impossible to escape. All you have to guide your way are the scribe's tokens, which match certain doorways, allowing you to pass. Will you be able to make it out of the labyrinth alive?

At the start of the game, you roll to see how many of each type of scribe's tokens you receive. There are six types of tokens, each one associated with a different Linear B Ideogram. If you ever roll for only one of a particular token type, you can choose a rotation token. There are six unique rotations tokens, which move the hex tiles in different ways.

You start the game at the center start hex, encircled by two concentric circles of hex tiles, the first circle containing six tiles, the second circle containing twelve tiles. The goal is to make it to one of the six exit hexes, located at various points beyond the second circle.

To move through the labyrinth, you match the token you have with the doorway you walk through. The token only has to match the doorway of the tile you are on - not the tile you are traveling to. Once you run out of a type of token, you can no longer walk through doors of that type.

Will you be able to make it to the exit before your tokens run out?

211813.description:
“When Barbarossa commences, the world will hold its breath and make no comment.” – Adolf Hitler.

Now you get the chance to refight the greatest campaign in history as you direct the armies of Germany and Russia from 1941 to the bitter end of World War II. Using blocks with labels as the military units you will maneuver your forces to best destroy those of the enemy.
As the German player you must push rapidly east trying to capture the key cities of Leningrad, Moscow and Stalingrad, not only fighting the Russian army but the winter as well. And as the Russian player you must withstand the German sledgehammer attacks as you trade ground for time, marshalling your forces for the counterattack that will drive the enemy backwards.

Russia ended up winning but history did not have to end like this, can you do better?

HOLDFAST EASTFRONT 1941 – 1945 will come with a large hard mounted game map.

From the manufacturers Kickstarter campaign description:

In 2012 we printed the first game under Worthington Publishing. It was Volume I in the World War II Campaign Series, HOLDFAST RUSSIA 1941-1942. We sold out of HOLDFAST RUSSIA 1941-42 last year and have had calls for a reprint ever since. Well rather than just reprint we decided to remaster the game with a larger hard mounted game board and expand the game to cover the entire war in the east.

We are now printing it as a new game, Volume V in the World War II Campaign Series, HOLDFAST: EASTFRONT 1941-1945. The game has been extended to 1945. The board has been expanded to push out to Berlin.

New units that appear later in the war are included such as Russian Air, and SS units.

The remastered edition will include the original game that ends in 1942 and a game that covers the whole war; To Moscow and Back 1941-1945. It also has 3 additional scenarios:

1. Fall Blau and beyond 1942-1945
2. Kursk 1943-1945
3. The destruction of Army Group Center 1944-1945.

214162.description:
This was appearance of the transparent plastic pyramids that would become known as Icehouse Pyramids or Looney Pyramids, and eventually be dubbed Looney Pyramids, in the presumable interest of more perspicuous branding. The clear plastic box contains four stashes (blue, green, yellow, red) and rules for Martian Chess, Zarcana, IceTowers, and IceTraders (an early version of Homeworlds). The three booklets (Ice Towers and Ice Traders share one) all end with suggestions for "other games to try" (referring readers to Looney Lab's website for the actual rules).

Also included are two Zarcana reference cards, an imprint-and-credits card, and a card with "cover art" and (on the reverse) an explanation why this product called Icehouse doesn't come with the rules for playing the game Icehouse.

Perhaps you're wondering why we call this an Icehouse set, when the rules for the game called Icehouse aren't included with the pieces. The short answer is, it's kind of like duct tape: Few people who use duct tape actually use it on their ducts... yet everyone still calls it duct tape.

The final item in the package is a sticker featuring Tirade the Broccoli, with the peel-off sheet on the reverse advertising other Looney games as well as their Wunderland "webzine".

215918.description:
Our intrepid adventurers have sailed on a journey, finding the hidden cave of a mythic monster. There are so many strange things there! The Captain allows the crew to search through the place and bring back to him what they have found, but by bluffing the Captain, they will try to keep the best part of the loot for themselves...

In Oh Captain!, an asymmetric game of changing roles, an adventurer must offer the loot cards they draw to the Captain, telling the Captain something about what the cards contain but not necessarily speaking truthfully. Indeed, some cursed objects can't be spoken of at all by the adventurers.

The Captain, who is safe from being attacked by objects, decides whether the crew member can keep the loot or not, and if the Captain turns down the offer, the crew member can decide to use an object against another adventurer. The latter player can overcome this by calling out a lie, winning or losing a coin based on who is right. The role of the Captain can be claimed by any adventurer who is richer than the Captain, and in the end the richest adventurer wins the game.

211823.description:
A micro-card game played in your hand. You take the role of the Jack, who is out to steal as many pies as he can before the Kings can catch him. Played with a unique deck of 17 cards, you have to use the abilities of your Jack to steal pies and avoid the Kings. If there are ever two Kings in a row, you have been caught! At the end of the game, tally up how many pies you managed to steal.

This game is based on the old poem "The Queen of Hearts".

215920.description: Lords of Spell and Stone is a worker placement game set in medieval times. Players train their people, dig moats, build towers and walls, buy herbal components, and cast spells in an attempt to earn the most victory points at the end.

217576.description:
An explosion of creativity and violence erupted in the Aegean Basin in 800 B.C. that defined ancient Greece. This combination of science, mythology, development, and war was led by powerful city-states like Athens, Sparta, Corinth, Troy, Byzantium, Corcyra, and Thebes. These states vied for control over their rivals and dominated the lesser states around them. In time, some of them became so well known that they are remembered even today.

Hellenica: Story of Greece is a 3.5X civilization game in which you harness the powers of one of seven beginning city-states to dominate the world around you. Your goal is to become the preeminent symbol of Greece for all posterity by completing a combination of secret and public goals. Will you be remembered as a warmonger or a peaceful philosopher? Great priest or apostate? Will you develop a devotion to the gods or focus on the advancement of your people?

Can you guide your civilization during these turbulent times? Will your vision of Hellenic civilization be remembered for all time, or will you merely be a stepping stone for another…?

215923.description: The first expansion for The King's Abbey. In this expansion, one player plays the Vikings, and is against all other "Abbey" players. This expansion uses a lot of the same mechanics as the base game, but the Viking player is building units to attack the other players in hopes to gain enough prestige points to overcome all other players.

211830.description: Munchkin Valentines comes with five valentines and envelopes to give you five chances to make someone like you. What's more, five small packs of Munchkin cards that fit inside the valentines are included so that you sweethearts will have something new to play together.

211834.description:
You have heard of a wondrous artifact, the Sampo, which will bring great prosperity to your country. Unfortunately, it has not yet been created! In order for the great smith Ilmarinen to forge the Sampo, you must bring him the finest wool of a lamb, a single grain of barley, white iron, and a white swan feather. However Louhi, the Sorceress of Pohjola, also wants the Sampo to bring her prosperity! Will you be able to gain the Sampo and return to the Stone Fortress of Kivimäki before Louhi can steal the Sampo?

There are four stats in the game: Brawn, Wits, Magic, and Luck. At the start of the game, Brawn, Wits, and Magic all start at 1, and Luck starts at 0. You have 9 points to distribute between the 4 stats. Each point means you roll an additional six-sided die when using that stat.

These stats are used for the encounters at each location. Each encounter is fixed, and requires certain stats or combinations of stats for you to succeed. These encounters are how you gain better stats, gain the items you need to make the Sampo, and once you have the Sampo, how you avoid Louhi and her minions.

Inspired by the story of the Sampo from the Kalevala.

publishers: Inside the Box Board Games LLP (ITB)
215942.description:
Description from the publisher:

Not all of you made it out alive. With the help of a mysterious corporation, return to the cave and search for your fallen friends.

Investigation adds 15 new item cards that grant your cavers powerful abilities. Recover them from the cave floor, or choose the ruthless Agent who starts fully equipped. The darkness hides many things. Be prepared.

publishers: Inside the Box Board Games LLP (ITB)
215943.description:
Description from the publisher:

You've returned to the cave, and you're not alone. A new threat has emerged from the shadows - faster, deadlier, and hunting you down…

Extraction adds more horrors to the cave with the new fast-moving Leaper hazard card. Fight them off with the Mercenary, a flexible blend of cautious explorer and powerful defender. Above all else, you must carry proof of the infestation back to the surface, or die trying...

publishers: Inside the Box Board Games LLP (ITB)
215944.description:
Description from the publisher:

You're in way over your head. The nightmares in this cave must be destroyed, by any means necessary.

Annihilation introduces a totally new way to play the game. Push deeper into the cave to reach points of structural weakness, plant powerful bombs, then get back to the exit before they detonate. The Exterminator can stop horrors from spawning and is immune to gas, helping keep your escape routes open while you complete your mission. This isn't going to be easy.

publishers: Inside the Box Board Games LLP (ITB)
215946.description:
Description from the publisher:

In this definitive collectors edition, you can explore the horrifying extent of the Sub Terra world, with the core Sub Terra game as well as all three modular expansions, introducing 3 new caver characters, new horrors, items and new game modes. Also included is the Sub Terra Graphic Novel, illustrated by David Thor Fjalarsson and the Sub Terra Development Diaries, with development notes from the entire Sub Terra team on how they brought the huge project together.

215947.description:
Payoff Pitch Baseball: 2016 Cards is a set of 1,500 cards — including players and parks — printed on high-gloss heavy cardstock for use with the Payoff Pitch Baseball base game.

L/R splits on batter cards as with all Payoff Pitch Baseball sets.

211852.description:
The Ministry of Discord, an international alliance of archvillains, has an opening for a new member. Each player in ROBOT RISE! is a mad scientist hoping to earn that coveted seat (and win the game) by eliminating all the other players.

The 110-card deck contains dozens of unique cards, including:
- Secret Bases: Protect these from being destroyed by opponents
- Giant Robot Parts: Assemble a giant robot to attack your enemies or defend against attacks
- Raid, Freeze Ray, and Mind Control are nuisance attacks that reduce your opponents' effectiveness
- Defense Cards: The best offense is a good defense...sometimes.
- Spy Attack!
- Disasters!
- And many others...

Need part of a Giant Robot to carry out an attack? Call for a temporary alliance with one of your opponents. After all, the enemy of your enemy can sometimes be useful.

Gameplay consists of playing a card (if you can), following through on the implications of that card, and then ending your turn by drawing a card. The game ends when there is one player remaining.

211853.description:
The box includes both games Werewolf & Mafia. Werewolf & Mafia are simple party games for 7+ players. Both games are a masterful creation of bluffing, paranoia, and mob rule. Mafia was created by Dimitry Davidoff in 1986. In 1997 Andrew Plotkin turned the game into werewolf. We love playing both of these games and have published a regular size deck but with the mini deck its even more discrete and portable.

Whats in the Box?

28 Werewolf Game Cards
28 Mafia Game Cards
Size: 1.75" x 1.25" (63mm x 44mm)
Finish: Magic (similar to a deck of Bicycle playing cards)

217581.description:
Description from the publisher:

It's time for a new leader to be selected by the gods to lead the nation. To help sway their decision, players must make offers to win their favor.

In Kronia, favor tokens are placed in three different temples, then players will make secret offers to these temples over the course of twelve rounds. Everyone starts with the same offer cards, so they must anticipate which Gods other players want to please. Deciding when to spend the more appealing offers and when to hold off can be the difference. In the end, the player with the most points from their favor tokens will be chosen to lead the nation into the future.

212803.description:
A boardgame in the theme of Wickie the Viking.
Eric the Terrible has stolen the valuables of the people of the town of Flake. He hid them on his treasure island. Wickie and Halvar are on a mission to retrieve them.
In the game you play with Wickie ("intelligence" - 1 and 2 moves) or with Halvar ("brute force" - 1 up to 4 moves). They move across the five areas of the island.
Wickie moves slower across the island, but if he can remember the part of the treasure (number of coins) on the card, he is certain of getting that part of the treasure.
Halvar moves faster across the island, but needs an adequate weapon (viking card of the same color) to collect the treasures of the area he is in.
We play until we have retrieved the entire treasure Eric the Terrible has stolen. Amongst the players, the one that has retrieved the most of the treasure gains the most honour.

215957.description:
Follow That Car is a fun transport-themed matching game which can be enjoyed by all the family! Build a road by matching either the colour, animal or vehicle type and be the first to get rid of all your cards. However, watch out for roadblocks, which other players can put down to block your path! You can also use roundabout cards to extend the road layout and add more cards.

This is a great game not only to develop matching skills but also colour recognition as children can be encouraged to name and match the brightly coloured vehicles. Children will also love the fun animal transport illustrations, from elephants driving cars to sheep riding tractors!

Contents:

36 vehicle cards
1 roundabout card
3 roadblock cards (police car, flood, roadworks)
1 instruction leaflet

212804.description:
A cooperative game in the theme of the Kids' series Night's Watch ("Nachtwacht").

Somebody opened the gates to the underworld. Monsters have free reign. The heroes of the Night's Watch are their to combat them, together.
They patrol through Twilight Town by rolling the "walk die". By being attentive during their patrol (a 1/3 chance roll of the "walk die") they can gather skills (up to 5 skill cards).
When on their patrol they encounter a monster they have to do a skill test. If they pass (roll 1 of the remaining skills required OR use the proper skill card), they hurt the monster. If they give the monster the final blow, the monster is defeated and removed from the board. If they fail, they loose health points (1 of 3). Incapacitated heroes can still help the party with their skill cards.
The Night's Watch wins if the monsters are all removed. However, the monsters win if EITHER all heroes are incapacitated OR no more skills can be learned (a skill card must be drawn but all skill card deck is empty).

217583.description:
From the publisher:

On the monster party secretly two escaped. Let's go to the search: With good memory, the players quickly find out who is missing!

The Monster Party It's suddenly haywire. Of the six monsters, two monsters have disappeared and the players are looking for the right. If you can remember well which monsters are still at the party, you win the game.

215965.description:
The Great Whee Race is a tabletop racing game set in an alternate prehistory where our Human ancestors – the Archaic Homo sapiens, or Ahs for short – rub elbows with Neanderthals, Dino sapiens (dinosaur men), Florz (small Ahs), & other species. Dinosaurs still roam the Earth & magic actually works! A sub-species of early Humans called Neuro-Evolutionary Rostral Developers (abbreviated as N.E.R.D.s) has recently evolved, & N.E.R.D.s have been busy inventing all sorts of amazing “cavepunk” stuff.

One of their most popular inventions is the downhill racer, popularly known as the Whee in Cave-Speak. Many different styles of Whees have been invented, & the N.E.R.D.s who invent them almost always claim their design is the best.

A bunch of prehistoric Clans have gotten together to test these claims. The Great Whee Race is about to begin! Each player chooses a Whee Racer, & then purchases a Crew & Cavepunk inventions. The racers then vie to be the first to cross the finish line in a race down a big hill. And just about anything goes in The Great Whee Race, so you’ll have to outmaneuver, outfight, & outwit your opponents in order to win!

The Great Whee Race is played on a track overlaid with a square grid. From 2 to 5 racers vie to make it to the finish line first. Each racer - called a Whee in Cave-Speak - is controlled by 1 player (or team of players), A variety of prehistoric-ish species serve as crew members, & give various bonuses. Whees can be outfitted with melee weapons, missile weapons, or both, as well as cavepunk inventions.

Once the downhill journey begins, a simple card-based simultaneous movement & action system is used so that players don’t know where anyone else is going when they choose their movement. This has 2 nice effects: players are all active throughout most of each turn, & perhaps more importantly, there are usually LOTS of collisions.

A unique “game mechanic” is used to resolve all actions: the Rok Draw. Every time they attempt an action or have a contest with another player, a player draws from a pool of tokens consisting of 3 kinds of Roks. Bonuses & penalties add to or subtract from the number of Roks drawn. Most actions have the same target for success, so they are resolved quickly. Players can use 1 of 6 pre-made Whees & crew, or can customize their own using a simple point build system. There’s another PDF included with track sections, templates, Whee Racer stat cards & models, & all the tokens you’ll need.

211873.description: Ogre Reinforcements includes units, scenarios, and rules for use with both the sixth edition of Ogre and the Ogre Designer's Edition.

211877.description:
Lock ’n Load Tactical Compendium. Volume 1 is the WW2-Era edition, and it collates, in a re-edited and updated format, all of the essential WW2-Era LnLT articles, maps and scenarios from every issue of Line of Fire magazine, plus some new content, including four new scenarios.

In the Compendium Volume 1, you can read indispensable articles on infantry and tank tactics—it’s like attending advanced combat training in 10 pages! Learn how to best place obstacles when you are on the defensive, and how to tackle the difficulties of the Fog in Noville, Bastogne’s Outpost. Read about the history and tactics of the battles for Kellam’s Bridge and the Norman village of Cauquigny and then play the two scenarios. Detailed descriptions of the Japanese forces in Heroes of the Pacific and the British forces in Heroes of Normandy also provide background and tactical insights on how to use them. Plus, fiction from the East Front and a history of the US Armored Divisions.

Scenarios comprise the bulk of this Compendium, and more scenarios equal more gameplay for your existing games. From the desperate moments of the Blitzkrieg in 1940 to North Africa in 1942 to Normandy in 1944 and across France to Holland and into the Hürtgen Forest of Germany, in four new scenarios played on redesigned maps. With over 110 pages, 22 scenarios and six maps, this Compendium has something for everyone who’s a fan of the Lock ’n Load Tactical series’ WW2-Era games. And it’s all right here: One game system, one era, one place!

name.#text: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Compendium Volume 1 World War 2 Era

211882.description:
The ancient Gates of Antares link or isolate worlds across countless galaxies. The evolved panhuman races wage unending war to control the Gates and the undiscovered systems beyond.

Take on the battling forces of the Concord IMTel, the symbiotic Isorians, the bio-adapted Boromites, the twisted Ghar Empire or the warlike Algoryn Prosperate to claim control of the Gates that lead to new planetary systems to trade and colonise.

With each faction bringing a unique twist to the otherwise simple rules, roll the Skirmish dice to score victories on your campaign and claim the Gate. Each player’s round represents a military offensive that will give the chance for scoring victories, but be aware of the Fate dice opponents will play against you as they can twist your results and turn a clear victory into a total failure!

name.#text: Beyond the Gates of Antares: The Dice Game

211892.description:
In 2784, the departure of General Alexsandr Kerensky and the remnants of the SLDF from known space leaves the Inner Sphere balanced on a knife-edge. With no Star League to keep the House Lords in check, greed, ambition and old grudges come to the fore once more, propelling the five remaining Great Houses into a war that threatens human civilization itself: The First Succession War.

The First Succession War describes the most devastating conflict ever fought by mankind as the five Great Houses battle for supremacy in the ruins of the Star League. Covering the collapse of the Star League, the militarization of the Inner Sphere and the horrors that ensued, this volume provides a detailed look at the major actions of the war, the motivations of its participants, and the deadly consequences of their decisions.

211895.description:
Description from the publisher:

Join the fun of Family Guy: Stewie’s Sexy Party Game with the Mouth Full of BLANKS Game Booster! Now you and your friends, along with your pets, your boss, that jerk at work who keeps going on and on about his fantasy team, your favorite bar, and that cool catchphrase you used to say all the time in high school but now looking back you realize it wasn’t that cool, can be a part of Stewie’s Sexy Party Game.

Mouth Full of Blanks is a set of Blank Word Cards featuring every category and character from Stewie’s Sexy Party Game. GF9 couldn’t “go there” but with a Mouth Full of Blanks Game Booster, you can absolutely “go there”. Go ahead, add your own People, Places, Actions, Descriptions, Things and Quotes to the game, we won’t tell!

name.#text: Family Guy: Mouth full of BLANKS

215992.description:
In Xếp Toán: Math in Wonderland, players have to find their ways out of the mystical forest. Follow the instructions of Friendly Mushroom and make accurate Math equations is the key. Who will be the first one to get out of the forest? Who will be the fastest and smartest one? Let’s do Math together!

Xếp Toán – Math in Wonderland is a calculation and action game. After rolling the dice, the first player to say out loud “Xếp!” will get the turn. He/she will combine the tiles to make an accurate equation that gives the same result in the dice roll. Each tile will give you 1 points and star tiles give 2 points. The one that has the most points after the tiles run out will be the winner.

You can both learn Math and have an enjoyable time in this game!

211897.description:
Description from the publisher:

Family Guy: Stewie’s Sexy Party Game is in full swing, but there’s still one more guest to invite – Quagmire! Add everyone’s favorite deviant to the game with the Quagmire Card Pack. This 80 card pack adds new, inappropriate word cards to fool around with including some of Quagmire’s favorite people, places, things and phrases.

211899.description:
Description from the publisher:
The Fate of Flanders was to be decided on the Sambre — Republican France against Imperial Austria.

The decisive Battle of Fleurus led to the Austrian loss of Belgium. With the two armies clashing again at Mont St Jean, the campaign gave the French Republic additional resources and manpower, opened the gateway to Germany, and the port of Antwerp to the French navy.

Fleurus 1794 is an Expansion Game Module for Napoleon's Last Gamble. It requires the south map from Napoleon's Last Gamble and the southern-extension map from Napoleon's Last Gamble Expansion Kit. The four scenarios cover the battles of Fleurus and Mont St Jean played on the NLG maps. Veterans of TLNB will have an opportunity to examine a key campaign from the French Revolutionary Wars.

211902.description: A puzzle, memory matching game in which players try to reveal their treasure pieces from nine piles of tiles that form a treasure map. As players reveal pieces, if they belong to their own color, they play it immediately. Otherwise they hoard the pieces of the other players to force them to "steal" by taking a random tile in order to complete their treasure puzzle. The first player to collect and arrange to form their treasure picture wins.

name.#text: Captain Scrimshaw's Digg'n Pirate Treasure Puzzle Game
