Say Cheese Cafe is a multiplication tables board game for students of grade 1 and up. It is designed to get them 14 times more multiplication tables practice than classroom.

Similar to their first product, Cafe is a more advanced version of Say Cheese with the addition of "rotten coins", "dessert coins" and a spinner which sets the "cheese" value to a random number instead of the standard "4" in the base game.

212566.description:
Big Catch is a division board game for students of grade 3 and up. It is designed to get them 8 times more division practice than classroom.

Each player draws a card on their turn with a number that must be divided by the current number of islands in play. A token is placed on each island equal to the result, with the remainders being saved for subsequent rounds. These can also be used to move from island to island, creating an area-control mechanism.

There is also an included dry erase slate to help the child work out the problems with long division.

The first to get to "Home Island" wins the game.

216664.description: Die Jokerbohnen is an expansion for Bohnanza. It contains six cards with the "Jokerbohnen". The "Jokerbohnen" can be placed on every other bean card.

212981.description:
The race for land on Mars grows stronger! Catrem is a game for 2-4 players aging 12 and up. An average game takes about 30 minutes. The game takes place in an advanced technology era where players are trying to capture the most wanted territory on Mars, Catrem.
Catrem is played by using numbers and symbols on cards of certain meaning to defeat other players. The goal of the game is to destroy your opponent's’ defenses, and be the last faction standing!

Combo: This is the core mechanic of the game. To Combo, the Active Player must combine (sum the numbers on the cards) at least 2 cards and total it up to a final card. For example if i have a Blue 4, Red 5 and a Green 9 in my Play-Area; i can combine the first two cards and total it up to the 9, which is equal to the green card, dealing the total as damage to my opponent’s defense. Note that making a Combo is independent of the colors on the cards you are using. 1 can be counted as both “1 and 11” in value, and the special cards all have a value of 10 in the case of making Combos, and each has different abilities when you finish your Combos with them.

When a player performs a Combo, he puts the final card of the Combo on top of an opponent’s face down defense card. Think of the final card of the Combo, the troop that you are sending to an opposing faction’s defense. Each defense can be destroyed by a minimum of 21 damage. When a defense card has cards on it with a total of 21 or more, that defense gets destroyed, in which case the player whose defense got destroyed reveals the defense card and adds it to his/her Play-Area to use it on his/her next turn.

The game comes with 112 cards consisting of:
2 sets of cards that starts from 1 and goes to 10 of each color, with different weights. (Blue, Green, Red, Yellow)
2 sets of special cards which are Bonus Attack, Reinforce, Shuttle and Swap Tech.
The last player remaining will be declared winner, and the owner of the most prestigious land on Mars, Catrem!

212572.description:
Description from the publisher:

The murky depths of the Pacific ocean conceal untold horrors in Omens of the Deep, a new expansion for Elder Sign, the cooperative dice game steeped in the lore of H.P. Lovecraft’s terrifying mythos. Based on the popular The Call of Cthulhu expansion for the Elder Sign: Omens app, players can now venture forth from the confines of the museum and board The Ultima Thule to combat the Ancient Ones that have begun to stir in the depths of the Pacific.

The new R’lyeh Rising mode of gameplay features two stages as you first navigate the Dark Waters track and then assemble the Amulet of R’lyeh to stop one of three dangerous new Ancient Ones from waking and devouring the world. Engage the newly introduced mission tokens for hard-won rewards and fend off the dogged Deep One Legion as your investigators move to unknown dangers on the Pacific Adventure cards. The depths of the Pacific are filled with fresh terrors that only the bravest can attempt to seal with the power of the Elder Signs in the Omens of the Deep expansion for Elder Sign!

name.#text: Elder Sign: Omens of the Deep

212573.description:
Deep inside the mine, the investigators have stumbled across something sinister. They have previously encountered fear embodied. They have stared into the depths of madness. They have even fought against a madman who sought to dominate their psyches. But how will they be able to defeat a demon born out of the darkness infesting their own souls?

Dagon is coming. And he is not rising from the sea: he is rising from the filth inside your own mind. This is Rise of Dagon, a new expansion for Deep Madness.

Contains:
- 1 Storybook, 3 Scenario boards, and 5 room tiles
- 12 Deep One miniatures
- 5 Hydra miniatures
- 6 Shadow of Filth miniatures with colored bases
- Dagon epic monster miniature
- Dashboards & over 100 cards
Plus:
- Ward Phillips Novelist Kickstarter-exclusive miniature

212574.description:
When the investigators first came to Kadath, they received a vision of a man intent on helping them defeat the terrors rampant in the mining facility. Little did they know that one of their only allies would turn into one of their greatest threats. This is The Oracle’s Betrayal, an expansion for Deep Madness.

Contains:
- 1 Rulebook & 1 Storybook
- 5 room tiles & 3 scenario boards
- 3 Dissected miniatures
- 12 Victim miniatures
- 8 Collector miniatures
- William miniature
- 80 cards
Plus:
- 1 Detective investigator miniature, Kickstarter-exclusive

212579.description:
User summary:

Mickey's Poppin' Magic is a children's pop-o-matic action game with a Disney theme. Players move pegged stand-up tokens (Minnie Mouse, Donald Duck, Pluto, and Goofy) around the edge of a 3-D plastic popcorn bowl. The playing surface is a series of holes (designed to fit the pegs, of course) with a hidden trigger mechanism underneath. If the pop-o-matic die roller indicates a "popcorn" result the trigger is activated randomly, possibly knocking somebody off the pathway. Players also trigger a random poppin' event when they land on a popcorn space. First player to complete the circle is declared the winner.

Designed for 2, 3, or 4 players ages 4 to 8 years old. No reading is required to play. Spanish rules are included.

212580.description:
Pixel Tactics is a head-to-head game of tactical combat for two players. Each player has an identical deck of 25 cards, from which they draft a leader. The leader's abilities alter vastly the strategy and playability of every other card in the deck, making the game playable in 25 different ways.

In the game, players take turns placing cards and attacking. Each card can activate in various ways, taking on offensive capabilities in the front rows of the unit, or support powers in the back rows. Cards can also be played as orders – powerful single-time effects that can turn the tide of battle.

Play continues until either player's leader is defeated. A typical game is best of three or five rounds.

Mega Man Pixel Tactics: Blue features 28 characters from Mega Man 1-3 — including Mega Man, Dr. Light, and Robot Masters — and these characters are compatible with all other Pixel Tactics games.

name.#text: Mega Man Pixel Tactics: Mega Man Blue

212581.description:
Pixel Tactics is a head-to-head game of tactical combat for two players. Each player has an identical deck of 25 cards, from which they draft a leader. The leader's abilities alter vastly the strategy and playability of every other card in the deck, making the game playable in 25 different ways.

In the game, players take turns placing cards and attacking. Each card can activate in various ways, taking on offensive capabilities in the front rows of the unit, or support powers in the back rows. Cards can also be played as orders – powerful single-time effects that can turn the tide of battle.

Play continues until either player's leader is defeated. A typical game is best of three or five rounds.

Mega Man Pixel Tactics: Red features 28 characters from Mega Man 4-6, including Proto Man and Robot Masters, and these characters are compatible with all other Pixel Tactics games.

name.#text: Mega Man Pixel Tactics: Proto Man Red

216679.description:
Card, Board & Strategy Game.

The objective of the game is to get rid of all weapons on hand in series of attacks.

The first player who gets rid of all his weapons wins the 1st place, the second player - the 2nd place and so on.

The last player left holding cards takes the last place.
Each weapon has its own power units that determines its ability to attack and defend.

All weapons are ranked by colors - an attack of a weapon can be beaten by a weapon of the same color.

216680.description:
With a roll of the dice, move your piece through the major Jewish events in medieval Spain.

Pull Explusion or Daily Life cards (as directed by the space you land on), which might cause you to be reincarnated (Gilgul space) as a different historical person (Nefesh/Soul cards) or put you in danger of excommunication (Herem space).

Along the way, those cards can also gain you tokens for: Torah (learning), Avodah (service), Gemilut Hasadim (showing kindness), and Emunah (faithfulness).

Once you have 18 tokens (the same number as the Hebrew word for life), go to the 7th Heaven (Aravot) and pick a judgement (Din) card. Sometimes the King of Demons has tricked you into a lower heaven. But often your deeds are judged as Holy...and you WIN!

name.#text: Expulsion: Jewish Life in Spain from the Golden Age to 1492

217020.description:
Truck off is a lightweight food truck card game that packs some serious bite! In Truck Off, you send your food truck team hoping to score a sweet parking spot at a lucrative venue. Your timing and game plan will be critical to your success while your opponents will look for the perfect opportunity to get you to Truck Off!

Truck Off is played over 5 rounds where the winner is the player with the most money earned. Each round, players simultaneously select and then reveal which venue they will park at placing their food trucks next to that venue. Each player then simultaneously selects which special action(s) they choose to execute this round. Starting with the first player token, players play and execute one action in a clockwise manor until all actions have been played and executed. A die is then rolled at each venue to determine how many people actually showed up, and profits are split between each truck at the venue.

Truck Off game-play mechanically captures the ups and downs of food truck owner by rewarding both long-term planning and short-term tactics as well as throwing many curve-balls such as low venue attendance, competition, and crazy weather.

name.#text: Truck Off: The Food Truck Frenzy

216684.description:
A push-your-luck game involving donkeys. The object of the game is to move your donkeys to the feeding spaces and take the best food. Every turn each player will anounce how many spaces the would like to move. Then they will throw the die and if the result is equal or higher than their declaration, they will move that number of spaces.

However, if the result is less, they will stay in the same space, an also they can move backwards if the result is a -1. The neat part of the game is that a donkey lands on a space with another donkey, they pile them, and the player on the bottom must obey the orders of the higher donkey.

Has nothing to do with other games called Huckepack, and is suspiciously similar to Die Heisse Schlacht am Kalten Buffet. No author is credited on the box.

218386.description:
Desciption from the publisher:

This first-ever Magic expansion features some of the most powerful cards ever printed. Relive the tales of Sindbad and Aladdin, battle powerful djinns and efreets, and journey to strange exotic lands.

There are 78 unique cards in Arabian Nights. It features mechanics like coin flip cards, lands with abilities, djinns, and efreets.

216686.description:
Description from the publisher:

A multiplayer (2-5) card game on power politics in the fictional Latin American country of Virtualia, after the departure from power of its strongman leader Jesus Shaves (pronounced “hay-sus sha-bezz“)... actually a thinly-disguised post-Chavez Venezuela (though when first designed in 2013, it wasn’t post-Chavez yet).

The game is semi-cooperative and semi-competitive, and plays up the constant tension between these urges. As players vie to create the largest and most durable personal power base (scored periodically throughout the game), the card deck delivers more and more crises that players must deal with collectively (and collect small rewards immediately), or the country will collapse. Coups d'etat provide another quick way to score!

Offered both in free print-and-play and assembled versions. The free PnP version consists of 90 cards, 230 counters, and the usual rules and play aids; the assembled version has 90 cards printed on coloured cardstock, 120 die-cut, pre-punched counters, and 120 wooden cubes.

212594.description:
The stated object of the game is to "do everything you can to survive out-of-control government, corrupt unions and environmental weenies who want to destroy your business and livelihood." The object of the game is to be the last player with at least one franchise, or to be the first player to complete four circuits of the board and roll "some snake eyes"; failure to roll two ones on two six sided dice on completing four circuits eliminates that player from the game.

As with many games of this genre, the focus is on political satire rather than game play.

216694.description:
You need to collect antiques in Das Vermächtnis Des Maharaja, a.k.a. Maharaja, but more than that you need proof that those antiques form a collection and aren't merely a hodgepodge of old trinkets.

To set up the game, shuffle the 36 antique cards (six types in six colors), lay out four on the table, give each player 4-5 rupees (depending on turn order), and lay out the fifteen collection cards. Place the trade cards — numbered 4-3-3-2-2 in a four-player game — on the table in a row, then place a gold coin worth 3 rupees on each trade card.

On a turn, a player either takes the leftmost gold coin from a trade card or pays the cost shown on the leftmost trade card bearing a coin to purchase one of the antique cards on display. After doing either of these, the player can claim a collection card as long as they own the antiques depicted on that card; many collection cards force you to discard one of the antiques depicted, which then sets you back toward claiming other collection cards. To end your turn, pay taxes so that you have at most 8 rupees. As soon as all the gold coins are claimed or the antique cards purchased, the round ends, after which you refill the trade cards and lay out four new antique cards.

Once the antique cards run out, the game ends and players discard any antique cards they hold if they have only one card of that color. Then they tally their scores based on their collection and antique cards and the money they still hold. Whoever has the most points wins.

216695.description:
In the card game Blindes Huhn extrem, players must do their best to avoid taking the blind chickens home with them. Who wants a blind chicken, after all? They just peck at things randomly, making a mess of the house.

The game consists of fifty number cards (0-49), seven penalty cards, and three reward cards. Adjust the number deck based on the player count, then deal cards evenly to all players. After receiving their cards, players order the cards in their hand however they wish, but then cannot change the order during play. Each round starts with the active player playing the leftmost or rightmost card in their hand, then everyone else does the same in clockwise order, again playing only their leftmost or rightmost card. Whoever plays the highest valued card takes the trick, then leads to the next trick. If you take a trick with more than one chicken in it, you take a penalty card equal to the number of chickens you took; if you take a trick with exactly one pig in it, then you receive a reward card that gives you a bonus in the next round, such as playing your card face down or playing from any spot in your hand.

Once all the cards have been played, players tally their scores: each chicken claimed in -1 point, penalty cards are -3 to -15 points, and reward cards are +3 points. Whoever took the last trick can choose to ignore all chickens they took or all penalty cards they took other than those taken on the last trick. If someone uses the 0 to beat the 49 in the last trick, then they can alternatively erase the entire score from a previous game.

Play as many games as the number of players, then whoever has the highest score wins!

212607.description:
Bring the fast-paced Western action of The Lone Ranger to your HeroClix collection! This easy mini-game combines Disney’s new film with the most popular pre-painted miniatures tabletop game for exciting gameplay.

Includes everything new and established players need to get started: Lone Ranger and Tonto HeroClix figures, an exclusive fold-out game board, quick-start rule sheet, scenario sheet, 32 bystander tokens, and dice.

212608.description:
Description from the publisher:

In the wild, you must adapt to survive! Will you win by having your Bears Eat Fish? Or will someone change the Goal so that their Frogs and Insects can make Night Music? Play ecology themed Actions and Rules like Scavenger or Composting, but watch out for Creeper cards like Forest Fire, that can hurt everyone! Discover a little about how things go together, with EcoFluxx - the nature game of ever-changing rules!

212610.description:
Description from the publisher:

Munchkin Wonderland transports players to the iconic world of Lewis Carroll's Wonderland novels. Move around the illustrated game board. If you land on a monster like the Jabberwock or Cheshire Cat, beat it with a roll of the dice and Treasure cards like Six Impossible Things Before Breakfast, the Vorpal Blade, or Stolen Tarts! Maybe you'll even get help from the Caterpillar or Dormouse.

When the deck of Treasure cards runs out, whoever has the most loot wins!

216707.description: Poteau Rentrant is the second expansion for Blanc Manger Coco. It contains 40 question cards and 160 answer cards.

218331.description: The family-friendly game Cards Against Profanity takes the popular adult party game and gives you a fun and wholesome experience that even your kids and their friends can enjoy. Designed for ages 8+, Cards Against Profanity has 75 quirky question cards and 425 funny answer cards. Each round, the "ruler" deals the players eight white answer cards, then flips over one orange question card. Players then place one of their white cards face-down. The ruler then selects the best answer!

216709.description:
KIEV 1941 - Biggest Battle of Encirclement is the first battle of KIEV theme wargame. In this game, One player takes the role of the Axis army while another player commands the Russia army. Players attempt to achieve victory by moving their combat units across the game map to attack their opponent’s combat units and occupy as many objectives as possible.

This is an introduction wargame, the game rule are easy to learn and play. Both players will find their leadership and strategic abilities put to the test as KIEV 1941's game systems let you recreate the classic battle of World War II.

COMPONENTS:
1 rulebooks (32 pages)
1 mounted map
1 counter sheet (77 counters)

families: Wings of Glory / Wings of War
216710.description:
In the summer and fall of 1940, after the fall of France, the German Luftwaffe faced the Royal Air Force in the first major military campaign fought entirely in the air — the Battle of Britain. This was the prelude to the invasion Hitler planned for the British Islands — Operation Sealion. An ultimate German victory was at hand, and British pilots bravely flew into battle, fully aware of what a defeat would bring to their country and the entire free world.

Now, with this Wings of Glory: WW2 Battle of Britain Starter Set you can bring to life the epic aerial duels between the Axis and Allied aces on your tabletop. Defend Britain as an Allied pilot, controlling one of the most iconic WW2 airplanes, the Spitfire, or fly dangerous missions as a German pilot in a powerful Messerschmitt Bf.109 fighter.

Wings of Glory is fast–playing and easy to learn. This Wings of Glory: WW2 Battle of Britain Starter Set is a complete game that includes everything you need to play the WW2 version of the system. Four airplanes are included in this set, each fully assembled and painted. Also included is a full-color rulebook, a scenarios booklet, a rich assortment of counters, rulers, and airplane console boards to start playing out of the box in just minutes!

name.#text: Wings of Glory: WW2 Battle of Britain Starter Set

216712.description:
User summary
煙血鋼撃 (EnKetuKouGeki) is a military-themed game for two players.

At the beginning of game, players have six units of infantry and six armored vehicles each, from which they form a squad of four infantry and an armored vehicle.

Each turn, they choose an command card from their hand and reveal them simultaneously. Each card has a speed factor and card effects. Resolve them in the order of speed factor, and try to damage opponents' squad.

You win the game if your opponent loses all four infantry, or opponent's vehicle is destroyed.

Publisher's summary
歩兵と機体を編成し、敵部隊の撃退を目指す
ミリタリーテイストな対戦ゲーム。

編成した部隊に命令カードで指示を与え、
様々なスキルを駆使して敵部隊に損害を与えたり、
自部隊の支援を行います。

最目標は、敵部隊の歩兵を殲滅あるいは敵部隊の機体の撃破。

216714.description:
User summary
武当掌門 (ButouShoumon) is a game for three players with a theme of power struggle in a Taoist temple in ancient China.

At the beginning of the game, players are dealt four cards each. One of these cards is the spy, meaning the player holding the spy card has to be in second place to win the game.

During the course of the game, players place their workers and exchange their cards to train themselves (increase their statistics), and gain victory points when you have enough statistics. Note that the spy card can be exchanged so you should keep track of it.

At the end of the game, if the spy player is at the second place, the spy wins. Otherwise the non-spy player with higher victory points wins the game.

Publisher's summary
武当山の道士達が次期掌門を巡って
争うゲームです。
そして、道士の中には朝廷のスパイが潜んでいます。

道士達は日々修練し、時には下山して外界の事件を解決し
名声を高めます。
最終的に名声が最も高い道士が掌門となり勝利しますが、
スパイが2位になると武当山の情報が朝廷につつぬけとなり
スパイの勝利となってしまいます。

216715.description:
User summary
ウサギの政略結婚 (Usagi no Seiryaku Kekkon) in English means 'Rabbits' Political Marriage'. It is a two-player co-operative game. Two rabbit nations, which have been hostile to each other, try to form a marriage between their prince and princess before the hostility leads to a war.

Five event cards are placed face-up on the table, so you know what happens in the next five turns. Events can be positive or negative, and some events even raise hostility level under a certain condition. Each turn, a player play an action card. An action card has two options. One is to gain a positive effect, such as gaining resource, or spending resource to collect victory points; and the other is to avoid a bad event, such as changing event order to avoid a hostile condition. You cannot always take positive effects. How you accept negative events is the key to victory.

If the hostility level is raised to seven, citizens' anger leads to a war and both player lose the game. Before that, players have to collect six victory points (intimacy level) to win the game.

Publisher's summary
仲の悪い2つのウサギの国が
戦争を回避するために、
互いの国の王子と姫君が政略結婚をするゲーム。

民衆の対立度が最大に達する前に、
王子と姫君たるプレーヤーが協力し、
物資を蓄えたり需要を回したりして
勝利点に変換し、政略結婚を成功させることを目指します。

name.#text: Usagi no Seiryaku Kekkon (ウサギの政略結婚)

216716.description:
This expansion adds 13 new monsters (One new monster for every existing stack of monsters) to add a new level of difficulty to Valeria: Card Kingdoms!

This expansion was the $100k stretch goal for the 2016 Valeria: Card Kingdoms – Flames and Frost Kickstarter, however the funding goal was not reached.

It next became available as an add-on in the Pledge Manager for that campaign around Dec'16/Jan'17.

name.#text: Valeria: Card Kingdoms – Expansion Pack #05: Monster Reinforcements

212621.description:
Description from the publisher:

Zen Squire is a 2-4 player card game inspired by medieval marginalia, absurd illustrations found in the margins of medieval illuminated manuscripts. The first edition (released on Kickstarter) includes 72-cards, a 54-card main game plus an 18 card expansion. All illustrations and design elements were produced in pen and ink and hand-painted with watercolor.

The goal of Zen Squire is to collect 1,000 points. Each player begins the game with five cards, drawing one card and playing one card each turn. Cards are played into the area directly in front of each player, this area is your Castle, the total sum of which is your score. Diplomat cards contain positive or negative points. Any player can play Diplomat cards to any Castle. Once your Castle totals to 1,000 points, you win the game.

Challenger and Defender cards contain actions, which can be played to the Discard pile in order for their action to occur. Actions may allow players to draw additional cards, steal cards from opponents, or even swap Castles! Rulers are played to any Castle and pair with a Diplomat card already in that Castle. Rulers cannot be removed by Challenger or Defender cards. Multiple Ruler cards can be paired with the same Diplomat card. Once paired with a Diplomat, Rulers may double that card's points, change a negative value to a positive value, or make that card immune to all actions.

216718.description:
In Haspelknecht: The Ruhr Valley, an expansion for Haspelknecht, coal mining has now become an inherent and lucrative business for farmers in the Ruhr valley. The tunnels are dug deeper and longer through the use of iron. Water channels are implemented to help drain the pit water. Most of the population earns their living exclusively by mining coal and delivering the black gold to peddlers and the first coal barges cruising the river, which gives its name to the valley and the entire area — the Ruhr.

This expansion features two new challenging modules and 21 new development tiles for you to explore!

212625.description:
The funny games of the Badgers is played two different ways:

Come Let Us Build A Cave!

All players try to build a cave together. If they manage to surround themselves on all sides with bushes, they have won. If the Frechdachs, however, takes 11 shrub game pieces during the game - the badgers cannot build a cave any more - so he is the winner.

The Search For The Pine Cones.

And again the game begins against the Frechdachs. But this time, every badger has to play for himself and try to collect as many pine cones as possible. Whoever has found most pine cones is the winner. You only know this when all the pieces are taken out of the game, and the number of the depicted pine cones is counted on the flipped side. Did you win now? Or was it the Frechdachs again?

212626.description:
Pack of "Garbage" given out to attendees of Gen Con 2016.

18 new "con" related cards.

name.#text: Garbage Day: Gen Con Promo Pack

212627.description:
Flirt is a game that gets players winning hearts by "courting" other players for their hearts.

Flirt is best played with friends, and with everyone saying the flavor text, with feelings and with a straight face.

Setup

Each player starts with three hearts of different values and patterns. The aim of the game is to be the first to complete a set of hearts with the same pattern.

Attacking

To attack, "Court" by using Court cards of equal or higher value than the heart you're targeting.

Defending

To defend, block Court cards by using other Court cards of higher or equal value to the Court card being blocked.

Win Condition

The first player that acquires three (3) HEART cards of the same pattern wins. If a player loses all his/her HEARTS, the player is out of the game.

212628.description:
The Mind & Emotions game explores our head and heart. In the beautiful box is a playing board, 120 cards, and a single die.

The game is based on the idea that we all have positive and negative states of mind, and positive and negative emotional states. The playing board has 3 columns with mind states on the left, and 3 columns of emotional states on the right. The positive states are on the top, and the negative states are on the bottom.

There are 2 piles of cards - 60 mind cards with blue backs, and 60 emotion cards with maroon backs. On the top of each card is one of the 12 mind & emotion states. In the middle of the card is a word that is an example of that mind or emotion state.

Each player takes a turn picking a card, and uses the word on that card to add to a developing story that’s interesting and fun.

For example, let’s say the first player picks the word SHY and begins the story: "Ever since Barry was a little boy, he was always SHY and had trouble socializing in groups."
The next player picks the word: INVESTIGATE, and continues the story: "One day Barry was reading the newspaper about a neighborhood near where he lived. The article described houses that sounded like an excellent investment, and he decided to INVESTIGATE."
The next player picks the word NEGLECTFUL, and says: "When Barry arrived at the neighborhood, he saw that it was run down, looking as if the owners were NEGLECTFUL of the most basic repairs."
While telling the story, the players move their pieces on the board trying to get each of their pieces into a top or bottom end zone. We’ll now describe the rules of the game.

2 to 6 players can play. Each player gets two pieces that are placed on the start section in the middle of the board, one on the left mind side, and the other on the right emotion side of the board. Each player moves one piece up and down the mind side, and the other piece up and down the emotion side. The goal is to get each piece in either the top or bottom end zones.

On your turn:

Roll the die to see how many spaces to move either piece.
Then pick a card from either the mind or emotion pile, and say out loud the category and word you picked.
If you picked a mind card, move your mind piece. If you picked an emotion card, move your emotion piece. If the word you picked is positive, move your piece up. If the word you picked is negative, move your piece down.
If the die is 2, 4, or 5, move your piece that many spaces. If the die is 3 or 6, move your piece 3 spaces up OR down. If the die is 1, roll again right away, and on this move you can move up OR down.
So there are two goals of the game. The first goal is to tell an interesting and fun story together. The second goal is to be the first to get both of your pieces to an end zone. The end zones do not have to be reached by an exact number of moves.

Positive-mind cards:
Analyzing, Interested, Aware
Negative-mind cards:
Oblivious, Uninterested, Unaware
Positive-emotion cards:
Up, Outward, Warm
Negative-emotion cards:
Down, Inward, Cold

You and your friends will enjoy many hours together playing the game of Mind and Emotions!!

216725.description:
The deluxe edition comes in a double tall box to accommodate sleeved cards, a plastic insert with separate card & bits sections, foam spacers to keep cards in place, foam cover for bits control, 5 tabbed divider cards, an action selection tile, a tableau tracker, and a box sleeve.

In addition, it comes with the Kickstarter Bonus Content Pack, Guild Halls expansion, and Monuments expansion

name.#text: Villages of Valeria: Deluxe Kickstarter Edition

212630.description:
This expension includes This pack contains 2 models, 2 character sheets (English on one side, French on the other), two Overlord tiles (non-lingual).


Valeria


This version of Valeria will still be adept at close quarter combat, however, she will be a more lightly equipped incarnation, faster and more dexterous, with other uses than just combat.


Taramis/Salome


Then, we have Taramis, the queen of Khauran. She eschews personal combat almost entirely but she brings her personal bodyguards to the table as well as being a great boon to her allies."
But that's not all! Taramis's evil sister, Salome is also playable with this pack as an Overlord minion. They are in fact twins and it is almost impossible to tell one from another, something that Conan discovers to his peril in the tale A Witch Shall Be Born.
Salome is a sorceress of great power and she is able to draw upon the being known as Thaug (a HUUGE creature) to crush her enemies!

216727.description:
Cuba and El Presidente released together in one box.


Game description from the publisher:

Cuba prior to the revolution: Under turbulent circumstances, the villages of the island strive for independent wealth and influence. Who can buy and sell his products and goods on the domestic market profitably or take in the most on the trading ships? Who can send the right delegate to parliament in order to influence the government legislative process, or erect distilleries, hotels and banks at the right moment to the benefit of his village?

Whoever has accumulated the most victory points in Cuba by the end of the game wins. Players earn victory points by shipping merchandise from the harbor, but also by erecting and using buildings, and by abiding by the law.

El Presidente:

The expansion to be used by 'Cuba'. An additional game board, more and different ship cards, laws, buildings, new character cards to be used with the other characters, and a whole new phenomenon: Cuba - the Arrival of the President!
In their turn, players may take and play a character from the 'El Presidente' board: the worker, dancer, attorney, warden, revolutionary or musician. They all have different effects.
The worker puts your goods into the warehouse; all your goods are safe this turn. The revolutionary gives you one victory point, the musician two money. The player with the dancer card becomes immediately the new start player; the old rule for determining the new start player is no longer in effect.

With the attorney a player may use a building even when his supervisor is not on the row or column of this building, paying one money. The warden may change two adjacent ships in position. There are two mule cards being used when playing with less than five players; these cards cannot be chosen. When all players have chosen a card, the car of the president moves to the position of the remaining card; remember, there are six cards that each turn are shuffled and randomly placed.

Under each card on the board are symbols that come into effect when the car of the president stops there. The first makes all law proposals go into effect; the second makes it possible to move the supervisor anywhere on a player board in the next round. The next symbol also is in effect for the next round: it allows you to pay one money and overbuild a building with another; the difference in resources must be paid as well. One symbol makes the leading player to go back two points on the score track; another allows players to purchase market wares at discount prices. Players must now not only consider which role they would like to take, but also which position they likely want to be visited by the president.

There are 2 additional laws in each of the four categories, so that the game can now last up to 8 rounds instead of just 6.
216727.name: Cuba (with El Presidente)

212635.description:
This map is an unofficial fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.

This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop.

There is an extra set of Tourist cards for the cities, each with a value to be earned by visiting that city. These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules.

There are also spanners along some tracks which may help or hinder you. The board does not have any grey tracks or parallel tracks - but there are some options in the spanner pack.

You can scale Bobotov Kuk for extra points.

There are many new options in the rules: exchange all your cards at the start but keep all the new ones: discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn: earn extra points: and many more. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.

name.#text: Montenegro (fan expansion of Ticket to Ride)

216734.description:
Dice Throne is a game of intriguing dice, tactical card play, powerful heroes, & unique abilities.

It's a fast-paced 2 - 4 player combat game (1v1, 2v2, or free-for-all). Select from a variety of heroes that play & feel completely distinct from one another. Attack opponents and activate abilities by rolling your hero's unique set of 5 dice. Accumulate Combat Points and spend them on cards that have a large range of effects, such as granting permanent hero upgrades, applying status effects, and manipulating dice directly (yours, your teammate's, or even your opponent's).


Let's take a look at a turn of the game.

The game begins with two players selecting their heroes. Player One chooses Moon Elf and player two picks Barbarian. Each player begins the game with 50 HP (Health Points)

Player One(the Moon Elf) won the roll to go first. The Moon Elf draws their 4 starting game cards and begins the game with one Combat Point.

Note- The player that wins the starting roll does not draw a card (above their starting hand of 4) or gain CP (Combat Point) above their 1 starting CP.





The Moon Elf then checks for status effects (like poison, or Burn) to resolve.

The next phase is called Main Phase (1). This is where the Moon Elf player can upgrade their hero board with cards from their hands if the have enough Combat Points to pay for the upgrades. They can also play any blue cards (Main Phase Action cards).
Then they enter the Offensive Roll Phase. The Moon Elf can take up to 3 roll attempts (with their 5 dice) to accomplish an action or attack from their hero board. After deciding on an action within the 3 roll attempts an action is declared.

Then the Defensive Roll Phase begins where the opponent (Barbarian)can use their defensive roll (as it appears on their hero board). The amount of damage or incoming status affects are resolved and that concludes the Defensive Roll Phase.


During Offensive and Defensive Roll Phase any player can play Roll Action Cards from their hand as long as they have the resources to pay for it.


The Moon Elf player enters their second Main Phase where they can do any final hero board upgrades or play blue Main Phase Action Cards.

The Moon Elf then must discard any extra cards over 6 from their hand.

The Barbarian player begins his turn by drawing one additional card (over his starting hand of 4) and gaining one CP (Combat Point) for a total of 2.

The Barbarian follows the same phases the Moon Elf did.

The game alternates hero turns until one player is at zero Health Points.



DiceThrone is for 2-4 players, ages 8+, and runs 20-30 minutes for a battle. With the ever expanding gallery of heroes the game feels fresh each time you jump in!

216738.description:
Kids game in which players "feed the pig" by alternating turns in which they flip a card representing different kinds of food.
For each card flipped, the player flipping the card turns the dial a number of times according to the number on the card (the less healthy the food, the higher the number on the card).
Each turn of the dial increases the pressure on the pig's stomach (a balloon).
First player to make stomach/balloon pop looses the game.
216738.name: Bollie Boem

216347.description:
Description from the publisher:

Statis Pro Baseball was one of the most accurate simulations of the sport of baseball produced in the 1970s. The new Advanced Game takes this 70s design into the 21st Century with modifications allowed by the terrific research of groups like STATS, Retrosheet, Baseball Prospectus, and sabermetricians from around the country. The main improvements come from the addition of LH and RH pitching and batting splits, a totally revamped and more accurate pitching formula, revised and expanded ratings for stealing, base-running, defense, clutch hitting, and ballpark effects. If you liked the original you’ll love the Advanced version, if you never played the original, you’ll discover a very accurate game that is quick and easy to play.

216740.description:
Czas Zaorać Socjalizm ("It's time to pulverize the socialism") is a mix of the card and the board game that brings players right into the fierce fight between right and left side. It's a game for 2-4 players, each with his own, prepared deck. Game is filled with well known persons of the right and left side of the politics. Players are using their cards to place them on the board and spread their controll and influence.

The game contains 210 cards, some of them picturing well known characters of the Polish politics, like Janusz Korwin-Mikke, Przemysław Wipler, Grzegorz Braun, Marian Kowalski (all of them used under permission) and so on, along with some historical ones, like Lenin or Stalin. Cards are divided into three fractions - left, right and neutral. Each player plays with his own, prepared deck. The idea is to place cards (characters and buildings) on the board, use the event cards to boost the statistics and finally, use them to make other players lose their Life Points (each player has 10 at start).
216740.name: Czas Zaorać Socjalizm

216742.description:
Based on the hit reality television show about pitching business ideas to big name investors for a chance to score real success. In this home version, the player with the largest net worth after six company pitches wins!

Players take turns being the Entrepreneur, taking a pitch out of a large deck of theoretical products and selling it to their friends the best they can. Their friends bid, or don't, and if one wins, they get to back the company and get any rewards associated with it. Get bonus money for backing projects that match your investor's area of expertise.

Caveat: The rules say this requires a die, specifically a d3 of colors, but one is not included. Most homes can easily use a d6 and designate two numbers each for the three colors, though.

217713.description:
Description from the publisher:

The Aliens are here and they need to collect a small herd of cows for investigation and cultivation. You and your alien friend have decided to make it a competition to see who can get the most cows.

The cows are laid out in a 4x4 grid and the players each taking turns looking at 2 of the face down cards and deciding if they want to put them back in the space they came from or swap them. Then they lay down one of their tractor beam cards (power 1-8) face down along their 2 sides of the pasture.

Once all tractor beams are placed they are flipped over and then the aliens compare the power of their combined 2 tractor beam cards that are at the end of each of the row and columns that meet at each cow.

The highest power combination wins the cow. Tied spaces causes the cow to be vaporized.

Quick fun game for 2 players in 6-9 minutes.

212648.description:
Did Indiana Jones rescue slave children from the Temple of Doom before King Kong terrorized New York city? Did Marty McFly first travel back in time in a DeLorean after Harry Potter's parents were murdered by Voldemort? Did the robots Wall-E and Eve meet before James T Kirk became Captain of the USS Enterprise?

In this game, players take turns trying to play fictitious event cards in a timeline. Featuring 234 cards from over 100 of your favorite fandoms from movies, television, books, and video games, Continuity is a unique and easy to learn card game that anyone can enjoy.

212650.description:
Baby GOUGGY is unhappy for different reasons. He may want; a dressing, a toy, pacifier, milk, his ball or take a bath. Determine why his sad and give to him what he desires. Take care to your babies GOUGGY not happy! Opponents can put down different disadvantage cards on them; booger, dirty bib, pee and even ... a big poop!

GAME PLAY
Each player performs this steps in order :

1. Draw from the draw pile and/or the discard pile for a total of 6 cards in your hand.
2. Place a Gouggy not happy face up in front of you to start a baby pile. Each player may have no more than 3 baby piles underway at a time.
3. Use a subject (dressing, toy, pacifier, milk, ball or bath) to continue your baby pile.
4. Once you have placed the appropriate subject card on your baby pile, you can place a Gouggy happy on that pile.
5. Place that baby pile face down in your points pile to make room for a new baby pile.


Slow down an opponent by placing a disadvantage (booger, dirty bib, pee or poop) over a Gouggy not happy. If another player places one of this card on one of your baby piles, you must first remove the card before you can continue building that baby pile. On your next turn, place the appropriate subject (handkerchief bib clean, powder, nose clip) to remove disadvantage. Once you have done this, place the disadvantage and the subject in your points pile.



The game ends once the player who draws the last card from the draw pile has taken his/her turn. When the game is over, count your Gouggy happy you have in your point pile. The winner is the player with the most Gouggy happy.

216753.description: In The Queen and Shoe Makers, players are challenged to combine upper cards and heel cards to make nice-looking shoes for the Queen.
216753.name: The Queen and Shoe Makers

name.#text: The Red Dragon Inn: Pharaoh's Toast
The Red Dragon Inn: Gizmo-Grade Oil

212662.description:
Description from the publisher:

You and your wicked companions have spent the day pillaging the countryside and "dealing" with meddlesome adventurers. It’s about time you kicked back with a pint at the evil equivalent of The Red Dragon Inn - The Black Dragon Depths, a nefarious tavern hidden deep in the catacombs below Greyport. No more heroes this time. Now you get to play as the bad guys!

The Red Dragon Inn 6: Villains is a the next stand-alone expansion to The Red Dragon Inn series of games. In this game you and up to 3 of your friends will be playing as evil villains celebrating the defeat of your archenemies at a wild fantasy party. You will gamble, brawl and drink the night away as you compete to be the last villain standing at the end of the night.

212663.description: Free cutout edition of Biberbande with only 32 (not 66) cards. The original goes up to 6 players, this version only supports up to 4.

212664.description:
A promo card for Snowdonia, given out for free at the Surprised Stare Games booth at Spiel 2016.

Only 50 copies were printed, so this card is very rare.

212668.description:
Description from the publisher:

Drawing Dead is a card game where you assume the role of a saloon patron from the Wild West in order to lie, cheat, and steal your way through a game of stud for the highest stakes imaginable: your soul. The characters in this world are doomed to walk the land of both the living and the dead, hoping to win this game in order to buy themselves a restful sleep - six feet under.

In order to win the hand, you will have to draft one of the many roles available to the players and use the character's special powers to improve your own hand and stop your opponents'. The game is familiar enough for those who know only the basics of poker, but robust enough to keep even the most avid gamer invested from start to finish.

212676.description:
This is the 6th in a series of Annual Games Unlimited Holiday Games and is the followup to Gameshop Express (2011), Gameshop Workday (2012), Gameshop Gladiators (2013), Gameshop Adventurers (2014), and Gameshop Expansions (2015)

To Win: Have the best gameboard collection by scoring the most
Victory Points (VP) based on your owned games and add-ons.

Setup: Each player receives 1 Collection Tracks card,
1 $/Shelves/Add-ons card, and 10 markers. Place 1 marker on the
1 Shelving Unit Track space and 1 marker on the $3 space on the
$ Track. 4 of the remaining markers will be used to mark Add-ons purchased. The other 4 markers will be used to mark a player’s owned games on the Collections Tracks. The 2 dice are given to the player who was chosen to go first. The first player will be the one who has most recently been to their favorite local gameshop.

Play: Each player’s turn consists of three phases:

Phase 1 Upkeep: Pay the listed upkeep fee on each of your Shelving Units. For each Shelving Unit a player cannot pay the fee for they must move a marker back 2 spaces on a Collection Track of their choice. Players do not pay the Upkeep fee on their first turn.

Phase 2 Dice: The player rolls the 2 dice and they may then reroll any die or dice an additional two times.

Dice are then used as follows:
(Note: dice faces 1 (red) and 2 (yellow) do not count as Collection Track colors)

A. Move a marker, adding games to a colored Collection Track matching one die color rolled (3 (orange) 4 (green) 5 (blue) 6 (purple)). The amount moved will be equal to 1/2 the value of the other die, rounded up.

B. Move a marker one space on a Collection Track matching one die color (3 4 5 6), and add the other die’s value to your $ Track.

C. Add both die values to your $ Track. Your opponent then moves a marker on any one of your Collection Tracks back 1 space.

For each Shelving Unit a player owns, they may move past the space (this space shows the first VP scoring amount on each track) on one Collection Track. They may not move past this space on an additional Collection Track until they own an additional Shelving Unit.

Phase 3 Expand: The current player may now purchase 1 Add-on and/or 1 Shelving Unit if they have the money to do so. Pay the listed cost and move the marker down that amount on the $ Track. Place a marker in the space next to the purchased Add-on. The first player to purchase a listed Add-on receives a $1 discount off the purchase price. The dice are then passed to the other player.

Add-ons: 1 Add-on may be purchased by a player each turn.
The first player to purchase a listed add-on receives a $1 discount off the purchase price. Score VP at game end.

Game End: The game ends when 1 player purchases all 4 Add-ons or
when a player reaches the maximum VP space on one Collection Track. The player’s opponent may then take 1 final turn.

Score each Collection Track you own a Shelving Unit for. Each track shows a VP number in a circle next to certain spaces on that track. Score the highest VP value reached or passed on a Collection Track.

Score additional VP for any purchased Add-ons the player has.

Highest VP score wins!

212685.description:
Description from the publisher:

Plan your battle. Marshal your armies. Eliminate the opponent.

EverZone is a strategic card game set in a distant future. Each player is in command of forces in order to defend his race and expand the control in the universe. Three races (Numan, Slurr and Uthron, most commonly distinguished between humans, aliens and robots) fight for the galaxy on different battlefields: uncharted lands, seas of planets and in the cold space.
The game's goal is destroying the opponent's "headquarters" by reducing to zero his command points (same as life points). To achieve this, players have 330 cards between units, supports and locations in order to build their own forces deck to use in battle against opponents, in the locations determined by each player. EverZone introduces a revolutionary game mechanism to minimize random elements, creating extremely tactical challenges.

EverZone: Colony Assault is not a mere expansion of a game already published some time ago, but it's a sort of EverZone 2.0.
In this new game you will have:

A new and more complete rulebook,
330 brand new cards with balanced and refined powers to give you a more exciting gaming experience.
A stand alone box, so that you won't necessarily need the basic game to play EverZone, but you can combine both of them to have wider strategies.




Besides, a third kind of card will be introduced: the structures.

Structures are paid by your own command points (or life points) and remain in the battlefield with permanent powers for your army until they are destroyed by opposing attacks.

212686.description:
Kebab-matador is base on Nørrebro, Copenhagen, Denmark. Here you have to buy all the stores and shops before the other players, so you can become the biggest gangster boss in town.

Unlike regular Matador (Monopoly) this game contains two alleyways where you can win big or almost lose it all!

The game is made from the idea of Manus Sareen who also wrote the Danish children book series "Iqbaal Farooq", and illustrated by Lars-Ole Nejstgaard.

The game is in Danish, and the first edition contains a free e-book on "Iqbal Farooq - og den sorte pjerrot"

212687.description:
Description from the publisher:

Play as a coven of witches conniving to concoct potions to entrance the local population! Each turn players choose from one of their 5 witches in a blind reveal mechanism. Each witch allows the collection of ingredient cards (to collect as sets) and condiment cards (to increase the value of specific sets). However, each witch picks specific types of cards and incorrectly deduce who earlier players pick and you may be left with nothing to pick up! The "recipe" cards included also give secret bonuses for concocting specific ingredient/condiment (potion) combinations which allow for great replayability and strategic depth.

212688.description:
Description from the publisher:

Cthulhu Crusades is a fast paced card game, as much about chance as strategy, set in the dark Middle Ages under the sway of the Necronomicon.

Storm the castle walls, make sacrificial offerings, invoke and call up creatures in this highly snappy card game.

*How to play

Your objective is to storm the enemy castle and take possession of their copy of the Necronomicon.

The shields represent the defence value of the castle.

To storm a castle you have to carry out an attack (swords) superior to its defences (shields).

To launch an attack you should gather army formations, represented by soldiers, bowmen and / or siege weapons cards (you can attack with one or several cards at once).

An attack is successful if the total number of swords (attack) is greater than the shields (defense) of the attacked card.

The Village deck provides the basic resources of your village: soldiers, archers, gold, cultists, sacrifices, builders, thieves, etc.

You start out with five cards and at each turn you will steal a card from this deck and carry out one single action (attack, defend, build, call up, sacrifice, etc.).

A castle cannot be attacked while its walls protect it.

You can place army units in defensive positions to enhance your defence.

The Siege deck contains siege weapons to carry out more powerful attacks.

Use builders and gold to construct your siege weapons.
Get special cards to scale the walls with greater speed and trick your enemies with the Cthulhu offering.

The sea hides the terrible Deep Ones. If you manage to keep them happy by offering sacrifices, they will reward you with additional resources but… you never know how many Deep Ones might come!

Lay ambushes for your enemies, steal their gold and surprise them with a night-time attack so they can’t tell what you’re attacking them with.

Use the arcane knowledge of your cultists to call up the powerful creatures of the Cthulhu deck and scare the wits out of your rival while in combat.

212690.description:
A two-player microgame with 18 cards.

Winner of the 2015 18 cards game contest.

Epic Fights: Kung Fu Masters is a confrontational two-player game, with a quick, very light, tactical gameplay. Two kung fu masters battle each other in 9 rounds, using various techniques and building up combos.

212692.description:
Promo coaster released at Gencon 2016

Spilled Ale:

Place the Spilled Ale side of the coaster on the board. It covers a 3×3 square area. These are called ‘Ale’ squares.

Any character that moves into an Ale square (and is on the floor) slides until they move off of the coaster, or hit a table, wall, or another character. This only counts as one square of movement. They may continue moving once they exit the coaster or are stopped.

If they hit a table, they stop sliding. If they slide into a square with another character, both characters start sliding until they are both no longer on the coaster, or hit a table or wall.

If player is Knocked Back onto an Ale square, they slide as above.

Rules for POKER TABLE:

The Poker Table side of the coaster can be used one of two ways:

As a Poker Table: Use two Large tables to support the Poker Table on the board. It is a 3×3 table, and is subject to all Table rules. It may be pushed, flipped, etc. The two tables that are supporting it are considered part of the Poker Table.

For Ilicit Gambling: The coaster is placed off of the board. Any time a character has to give reputation to another character, and the Coaster has three or fewer reputation on it, place one Reputation from the bank on to the coaster, in addition to the normal effects of the Action.

If the coaster has four or more reputation on it, the next time a character gains reputation they also take all the reputation from the coaster.

If an action causes multiple characters to give reputation, one reputation per character goes on the coaster. A character may only take the Reputation when it has at least four at the start of the Action.

216789.description:
Publisher's summary
GoRoGo is new Go variant game for two players played with each 10 ordinary black and white pieces and 5 additional neutral ones. Each player has two of the neutral pieces, and one starts on the game board.

Like Go, the game is played on a grid, but the board has only a 5x5 grid with 25 intersections and 40 paths. The purpose of the game is to obtain more of your opponent's pieces, not to claim an area majority.

Since there are only 25 pieces, the game is over after 24 moves at most. A player cannot pass, nor play a neutral piece last. If they don't have a legal move, they lose.

The neutral pieces are both black and white. That is, on Black's turn, a neutral piece is a black piece. Then on White's turn, it is a white piece. This allows moves that are normally prohibited in Go, such as 'Kou'. A player can attack into an area that in Go would be protected.

GoRoGo is a GO game but not GO. It means that the tactics are GO tactics but the strategy isn't GO.

212694.description: The COOKS of the CULT OF CTHULHU meet for the annual cooking ceremony of the tentacle stew. Whoever manages to chop the best pieces off the RITUAL TENTACLE will be appointed CULT CHEF for the next year.

212695.description:
They might look alien to us, but they bleed. Believe me — I've seen it. I was sent here to tell you that all over the world people are arming themselves against the alien threat. You must do your part here in Maryland. We're few, but we can win this war — as long as we're united.

Keep your head down… caught in the open, you will be dead.

Inspired by such classic computer games as X-COM: UFO Defense and Laser Squad, Invasion: Free State is a competitive urban tactical combat board game for 2 to 4 players. In each mission, Alien and Resistance factions conduct combat against each other in a desolate district of Annapolis suburbs.

To win, you need to predict and avoid the enemy maneuvers with simultaneous initiative and action selection system. Use cover to your advantage and don't let them outflank you.

Endless variability is provided thanks to a modular board and the unique character selection system.

216794.description:
This theme deck Includes:
1 60 card Pokemon deck
1 metallic coin
1 rulebook/card list
1 playmat
1 sheet of damage counters
1 Deck box
216794.name: Pokémon TCG: Diamond & Pearl

216797.description: This is a simple, luck-based game designed to simulate the play of American football. Using a deck of 78 cards, players select from among eight play types, including special teams options, then turn over the topmost card to determine the result. Two plays through the deck constitute a complete game. In addition to the card deck, the game contains a rules pamphlet and a pegboard for marking field position, down, and distance to go for a first down.

name.#text: Gridiron Football: The Realistic Football Card Game

212702.description:
A small game covering the Rumanian Attack against Odessa in 1941.
Romanian player selects activation chits for his wings and then pull a chit one at a time. He has three wings and two chits for each wing. So, he can have six activations in one turn. But, more activations bring Russian player more command points. With them he can move or attack with one unit.
Victory condition for Romanian is get the control or totally encircle the Odessa until the end of sixth turn.

4 pages rulebook
60 counters
one smaller map (B/W printed)

published on Command magazine #50 in 2003.

republished on #109 in 2013 with full colored map and larger counters.

216799.description:
Description from the publisher:

The San Juan Nepomuceno was a Spanish ship of the line built in 1765 in Guarnizo in Cantabria, on design of Francisco Gautier, along with other similar ships. She was used for many years for many different missions, many of them in the Caribbean. In 1793 she fought against Revolutionary France, especially in the occupation of Toulon. In the Battle of Trafalgar, she achieved glory under commander Don Cosme Damian Churruca and provided an incredible example of Spanish heroism, fighting British ships after the loss of over 400 officers and crewmen. Ultimately, she was captured and renamed by the Royal Navy.

This ship pack can also be used to represent the Spanish Nepomuceno class “San Francisco de Asis 1767.”

Ship pack contains a new ship with base, ship card, ship log, and specific deck of maneuver cards.

name.#text: Sails of Glory Ship Pack: San Juan Nepomuceno 1766 / San Francisco de Asis 1767

216800.description:
Description from the publisher:

The San Agustín was a 74–gun ship of the line built at the royal shipyard in Guarnizo (Santander) in 1768 by Francisco Gautier. After fighting during the American War of Independence and in the Battle of Cape St. Vincent (1780), she took part of the Napoleonic wars, where she fought at the Battle of Algeciras in 1801 and the Battle of Trafalgar in 1805. In Trafalgar, under the command of Felipe Jado and Cagigal with 711 men aboard, she was surrounded by several ships of Nelson’s squadron. They fought for hours, but after the third approach, she was after being dismasted and with 180 dead and 200 wounded, the British offered terms to surrender. The ship was burned on October 29.

This ship pack can also be used to represent the Spanish 74-gun ship-of-the-line class “Bahama 1780.”

Ship pack contains a new ship with base, ship card, ship log, and specific deck of maneuver cards.

name.#text: Sails of Glory Ship Pack: San Augustin 1768 / Bahama 1783

216801.description:
Description from the publisher:

The Bahama was a Spanish ship of the line, built in Havana in 1780. Originally designed as 64–gun by Ignacio Mullan, she left Havana for Cadiz on 1785. Here she was rebuilt and completed as a 74–gun, following the project of Francisco Gautier, the designer of Nepomuceno class. As a 74–gun ship of the line, she was armed with 74 cannons and a designed crew of 640. They were armed with 28 32–Pounder guns in the lower deck, 30 18–Pounder guns in the upperdeck, 8 32–Pounder guns and 6 12–Pounder guns in the quarterdeck, and 2 12–Pounder guns in the forecastle.

The ship was part of the Spanish fleet that participated in the Battle of Trafalgar, where she was hit by the intense fire of British ships, with 75 killed and 65 wounded. Her commander, Commodore Galiano, died after being struck by a cannonball. After capture by the British fleet, Bahama became HMS Bahama, following repairs in Gibraltar. She sailed to England and was used as a prison ship.

This ship pack can also be used to represent the Spanish Nepomuceno class “HMS San Juan 1805.”

Ship pack contains a new ship with base, ship card, ship log, and specific deck of maneuver cards.

name.#text: Sails of Glory Ship Pack: HMS Bahama 1805 / HMS San Juan 1805

216802.description:
Description from the publisher:

Protée was built in 1772 and designated as flagship of a convoy directed to India, departing with other ships as escort, transporting troops and ammunition. On 23 February, off Spain, the convoy met Rodney's fleet; Duchilleau, commander in charge, tried to lure the British by continuing on the same bearing, while the convoy escaped, escorted by the other ships. The British fleet chased and captured Protée.

This ship pack can also be used to represent the French Artésien Class ship-of-the-line “Eveillé 1772.”

Ship pack contains a new ship with base, ship card, ship log, and specific deck of maneuver cards.

name.#text: Sails of Glory Ship Pack: Protee 1772 / Eveille 1772

212707.description:
ROCKOMAN is a bigger and better version of the famous game ROCK–PAPER–SCISSORS. Fight with ROCKOMAN's superheroes to get the most points.

GAME PLAY
The players take turns going clockwise. On your turn, draw one card from the draw pile and place it, face up, next to the draw pile, in the discard pile. If your card beats the one of top of the discard pile, place all the cards in the discard pile in your point pile (rock beats scissors, scissors beat paper and paper beats rock).

When you draw a super card, place it face up next to your point pile. The super card beat card on the top of the discard pile at any time (rock suoer card beat scissors, paper super card beat rock and scissors super card beat paper).

When you place gun card, good card, sick card, rock-paper-scissors card, ring card in the discard pile, does the specified action to the opponent (take or give 3 cards, take his super card, play the standard game and the winner takes 5 cards from the loser’s point pile).

The game ends when the draw pile runs out. The winner is the player with the most points at the end of the game. Each card in your point pile is worth 1 point.

212708.description:
Expansion for Kodama.

(translated from the title card)
Contains 28 cards:
- 12 Season cards
- 7 Kodama cards
- 9 mini-Kodama cards

The mini-Kodama's enable you to play the game with kids from 6 years old and up instead of the normal 8 years and up.

name.#text: Kodama: Les Esprits de l'Arbre – l'Extension Florissante

216805.description:
Description from the publisher:

HMS Leander, launched at Chatham on 1 July 1780, served on the west coast of Africa, West Indies, and the Halifax station. During the French Revolutionary Wars, HMS Leander participated in the Battle of the Nile and was captured by French, then captured again by Russians and Turks. On 25 April 1805 cannon fire from Leander killed an American seaman with the resulting “Leander Affair” that contributed to the worsening of relations between the USA and Great Britain. In 1813 Leander was converted to a hospital ship under the name Hygeia.

This ship pack can also be used to represent the British Portland Class “HMS Adamant 1780.”

Ship pack contains a new ship with base, ship card, ship log, and specific deck of maneuver cards.

name.#text: Sails of Glory Ship Pack: HMS Leander 1780 / HMS Adamant 1780

216806.description:
Description from the publisher:

HMS Leopard saw service during the French Revolutionary and Napoleonic Wars, and was active in Europe, East Indies and Egypt. In 1807, a group of British sailors – some of American birth – deserted and joined the crew of USS Chesapeake. Captain Humphreys, commanding Leopard, requested permission to search for the deserters. Chesapeake’s captain refused, and Leopard opened fire, capturing the American ship. Humphreys took back four deserters and hanged the British–born ones. This incident was one of several episodes that increased the tension between the British Empire and the United States, finally exploding in the War of 1812.

This ship pack can also be used to represent the British Portland Class “HMS Leopard 1790.”

Ship pack contains a new ship with base, ship card, ship log, and specific deck of maneuver cards.

name.#text: Sails of Glory Ship Pack: HMS Leopard 1790 / HMS Isis 1774

216808.description:
Description from the publisher:

Petit Annibal was originally a British ship, the HMS Hannibal, built by Adams of Bucklers Hard and launched on 26 December 1779. She was subsequently captured by the French ship Héros off the coast of Sumatra, in 1782. She was called Petit Annibal to distinguish her from the eponymous 74–gun Annibal, which was in the same fleet. Admiral Bailli de Suffren took her into his fleet, and she saw service in his five battles against British Admiral Sir Edward Hughes in 1782 and 1783. She was decommissioned in 1787 and used as a hulk from 1792.

This ship pack can also be used to represent the French Portland Class “Leander 1798.”

Ship pack contains a new ship with base, ship card, ship log, and specific deck of maneuver cards.

name.#text: Sails of Glory Ship Pack: Petit Annibal 1782 / Leander 1798

216809.description:
User summary:
Historical battles: England 1940, It is the second installment of this saga, and it is the greatest air battle of the Second World War, unleashed by Germans and British, in this game we can take control of these and fight to win.

The objective of the game is to accumulate 10 victory points, the Germans do it for each bomber that arrives in England and the British gain 2 points for destroying a bomber.

User summary (Spanish):
Batallas históricas: Inglaterra 1940 Es la segunda entrega de esta saga, y se trata de la contienda aerea mas grande de la segunda guerra mundial, desatada por alemanes e Britanicos, en este juego podemos tomar el control de estos y luchar hasta vencer.

El objetivo del juego es acumular 10 puntos de victoria, Los Alemanes lo logran por cada bombardero que llegue a Inglaterra y los ingleses ganan 2 puntos por destruir a un bombardero.
216809.name: Batallas históricas: Inglaterra 1940

216810.description:
Description from the publisher:

Real Carlos was a 112–gun three–decker ship of the line, built following plans by Romero Landa for Santa Ana. She served in the Spanish Navy during the French Revolutionary Wars, but was destroyed during the Second Battle of Algeciras, with the loss of many of its crew. After participating in the capture of San Pietro Island for Spain and Sant'Antioco for France, in July 1801, she was in Algericas battling against the British fleet. The HMS Superb, cutting through the rearguard, maneuvered between Real Carlos and San Hermenegildo. When the Spanish ships opened fire, they struck each other and then collided, with fire spreading out of control. Both exploded and more than 1700 men were killed in the blast.

This ship pack can also be used to represent the Spanish Meregildos class “Conde de Regla 1786.”

Ship pack contains a new ship with base, ship card, ship log, and specific deck of maneuver cards.

name.#text: Sails of Glory Ship Pack: Real Carlos 1787 / Conde de Regla 1786

216811.description:
Description from the publisher:

The Príncipe de Asturias was another of the Spanish three–deck 112–gun ship of the line, based on the Santa Ana design by Romero Landa. She fought with a British squadron on 14 February 1797 in the Battle of Cape St Vincent, with 10 killed and 19 wounded. At Trafalgar, the ship suffered 50 killed and 110 wounded. After the battle, she had to be towed by the French frigate Thémis and undergo major repairs in Cadiz. She returned to fight in the Peninsular War, capturing many French ships. She crossed the Atlantic to Havana with Santa Ana to avoid capture by the French. In 1814 she struck a rock and was scrapped three years later.

This ship pack can also be used to represent the Spanish Meregildos class “San Hermenegildo 1789.”

Ship pack contains a new ship with base, ship card, ship log, and specific deck of maneuver cards.

name.#text: Sails of Glory Ship Pack: Principe de Asturias 1794 / San Hermenegildo 1789

216812.description:
Description from the publisher:

The Artésien was built in 1765 as part of a series of 12 ships of the line built to compensate losses endured by the French Royal Navy during the Seven Years' War. The Artésien took part in the American Revolutionary War, departing in 1781. A fine 1/28th scale model of the ship was used to instruct Louis XVI in naval studies and is now on display at the Musée de la Marine.

This ship pack can also be used to represent the French Artésien Class ship-of-the-line “Roland 1771.”

Ship pack contains a new ship with base, ship card, ship log, and specific deck of maneuver cards.

name.#text: Sails of Glory Ship Pack: Artesien 1765 / Roland 1771

216815.description:
In this board game adaptation of Mario Golf 64 from the Nintendo 64, players play through a full course of golf (18 holes), or the half-course (9 holes). Players assemble large cardboard tiles to make each of the 18 holes as well as assemble the plastic putting green.

Once the hole has been assembled, players in turn take control of a 4 inch tall mechanical Super Mario figure. Players choose the golf club (drivers/irons/putter) they wish to use for each stroke on each hole.

Once the appropriate club has been placed in Super Mario's hands, players pull back a lever to make Super Mario hit the small golf ball down the cardboard course. Players take turns on each hole, choosing their club for each stroke, and hitting their golf ball towards the green. The player with the lowest stroke count at the end of the game is the winner!

212721.description:
Description from the designer:

The year is 1921 and the Academy of Magicians has gathered once again to perform their greatest stage tricks. The competition to win the title of World’s Greatest Magician brings out the worst in these rivals who won’t hesitate at a chance to ruin the act. Fortunately, a good magician always has an assistant at their side and a trick up their sleeve…

Magician's Club is a "Trick-Making" game where players are Magicians who play Trick Cards for points. Moving around the table, the other players will try to decrease or modify the Magician's tricks using conjure cards. The Magician can cancel out some cards by using his assistant cards but they are one-time use only cards, so play them wisely. When play returns back to the Magician, they can play one more card and then collect the trick for points (either positive or negative)

After all the players have had a chance to be the on-stage Magician, the points are totaled up. A second chance to score happens at the end of the game by counting up collected cards that have a similar suit. The player with the most points wins!

212722.description:
Description from the designer:

Building the castle is easy! Climbing it is the hard part! Be the first fantasy hero to climb up the castle walls in pursuit of fabulous treasure. But beware of the monsters and misfortunes that can knock you back down!

In Castle Climbers, players lay tiles to build up a fantasy castle that they climb with their character. Players use action points to move their characters and roll dice and play item cards to battle the monsters that bar their way. Win and you keep moving. Lose and you drop back down! The first player to collect 100 gold wins the game!

212723.description:
After the experiences of improvised tank destroyer vehicles such as the M3 half-track with 75mm gun, M6 truck with 37mm gun and the M10 tank destroyer (3-inch gun on a modified M4 Sherman hull), the US Army were keen to produce a bespoke tank destroyer to hunt enemy armour. An order was issued in late 1941 to mount a 37mm gun in the requested vehicle. This was to be upgraded several times to 57mm, 75mm and then finally a 76mm.

The result of this development would be the M18 Hellcat - the fastest US armoured fighting vehicle of the Second World War.

M18 Hellcats served in the invasion of the Phillipines and saw action in Europe during the landings at Anzio in Italy and in Northwest Europe.

Hellcats were also exported to China where they served in an infantry support role.

The Hellcat could be found in the service of several nations following World War II with the Yugoslav army still fielding them into the 1990s!

212724.description: The Dragon Clan won the rights to colonize the Westward Isles in a series of duels with their rivals, the Shiho Clan. However, when the Emperors vessel expired, and his young heir too young and inexperienced to concern himself with the pretty disputes at the fringes of his lands, the promise of sole settlement rights died with him. The newly formed Prefecture of Ryu found themselves yet again in conflict with their old enemies, the Shiho Clan. Now, the Prefecture’s grasp of power is weakened, due to the recent Tsunami. Their forces are in disarray, they are fighting on all fronts in the aftermath of the disaster. But still the men and women of the Dragon are ready to take their place at Destiny’s table, uniting the human world by defending it against all threats.

name.#text: Bushido: Prefecture of Ryu Starter Set

212725.description: In the shadows and dark corners of the world, the worshippers of Yurei are gathering force. The many members of this Cult may not even be aware that they are serving the same dark masters, but serve them they do – the Yurei Bargain, which in its various forms allows control over life and death, has proven a temptation to many different people who would otherwise have nothing in common. In the Cult of Yurei, you may think yourself the master of your own Fate but you are always advancing the unfathomable goals of dark unseen masters. Even a puppet master has someone pulling his strings...

name.#text: Bushido: Cult of Yurei Starter Set

212726.description: They take the form of evil creatures of myth and folklore. From where they come or why, no-one knows, but one thing is for certain, the wave crushes everything in its path. The Oni and Bakemono demon-creatures that make up the bulk of the Savage Wave appear bent on the destruction of humankind and all that is holy, but they are not mindless – as many opponents have found out at great pain, the Savage Wave is cunning and organized, and it operates according to its own weird and unknowable logic. Some mad hermits and outcasts scholars whisper that this is not the first Savage Wave...

212727.description: The Ito clan have long been the laughing stock of the ruling clans. Never quite able to understand it is their own flaws which hold their greater ambitions back.
