You are one of the first members in a U.S. company that has made its way to Japan, and you are now trying to recruit new people to join you in this great opportunity with "Miracle Forever Japan". Can you become the richest player?

In マルチの頂点 (Pyramid Scheme), you start the game with a hand of numbered cards and choose one of them to represent the founding member in the pyramid of business supporters that you hope to build. On subsequent turns, you'll add new members to your pyramid, but the card played in the level below an existing member must have a lower number if placed on the left and a higher number if placed on the right. Some members provide special bonuses and actions, but sometimes you might need to leave a member face down to represent a prospect who didn't work out.

When the game ends, players score points for the members of their pyramids; the more levels you build, the more valuable those members who support everyone above them!

212976.description:
Art of Battle is a quick confrontation between two Strategists. Each one will choose two Heroes with different abilities, and those Hreoes will lead an army to achieve the objective: To defeat the opponent's Heroes. In addition to being able to select these magical characters, they will decide how to conform the army that will join them, being able to choose between Warriors, Lancers, Archers, Crossbowmen and Horses.
Before starting the bout, they will have the freedom to secretly design their own terrains, making each game a different game.
But it is not under control: chance will take care of the displacement of the troops and the resources of each strategist: these will play a fundamental role at the moment the battle is unleashed.

Español:

Arte de Batalla consiste en un enfrentamiento rápido entre dos Estrategas. Cada uno elegirá a dos Héroes con distintas habilidades, los cuales encabezarán un ejército para lograr el objetivo: Derrotar a los Héroes del oponente. Además de poder seleccionar a estos mágicos personajes, decidirán cómo se conformará el ejército que los acompañará, pudiendo optar entre Guerreros, Lanceros, Arqueros, Ballesteros y Caballos.
Antes de comenzar el combate tendrán la libertad de diseñar en secreto sus propios terrenos, haciendo de cada partida un juego diferente.
Pero no odo está bajo control: el azar se encargará del desplazamiento de las tropas y los recursos de cada estratega, que jugarán un papel fundamental en el momento en que se desate la batalla.

217077.description: 10 New Monsters, Actions, and Defenses filled with zombies and resurrection related madness!

name.#text: Gingerdead House: The Walking Dead Promos

217078.description:
28mm miniatures 23rd Century sci fi wargame. Player vs player or co-op, 1 vs game.

The apocalypse has come bringing forth the legions of hell. Demons obliterate and corrupt entires systems. The technology advanced militaries unite and battle the demons throughout the galaxy.

Choose form a dozen races, from humanoids, aliens, robots, monsters and demons. Command massive tanks and mechs. Destroy with arch demons and arch Angels. Lead your army to victory with hundreds of units and heroes to choose from.

For those liking the western armies, the Alpha Omega and Invictus Dominae are to command. For Asia fans, the Ming styled with manga art. For the darkness, choose the rough art of the demons.

An average game is 800 points with around 30 miniatures per side. deploy first and take your turn first. set up the scenery or play on the massive multi tiled board maps provided.

Move and attack. you can move all your units then attack or move and attack with which ever model you choose. Average moment is 10 inch and fast units are 12, jet packs 14 and heavy unit 8. Firearms like shotgun have a range of 10. Sub Machine Gun 14, Light Machine Gun 16 and rifles 18. Sniper rifles are 22 and 24. Once within range declare you target. you do not roll instead the target is hit automatically. If your unit has a firepower of 6 then it does 6 damage. But there are things that could affect this result for say the defending unit may has Relfex skill which is -1 to all incoming firearms damage or maybe they are wearing one of the many types of armour available which could avoid the attack all together. Stealth armour can be shot at from more than 12 inch.

Each unit has many skills and levels. the higher the level the better but more points they cost. Heroes are the best at level 5 and have around 10 skills each and can shoot 3 different weapons per turns or attack like melee and psychic abilities etc.

Some abilities are Lock On which means the enemy do not get a cover save. At the beginning of the game you also choose 3 army powers which you can use one powerful army power per turn but only once. Do not tell the other player your powers. You also choose your Dominus (General) and give that unit a Dominus power which is very powerful but if that unit dies and you've not yet used your power then tough luck.

Melee is the same as shooting. Move within 1 inch and attack. do the calculation of - and + for the skills in affect to give the total damage caused.

Blast weapons use a scatter dice. Pick the target and roll a D6 (6 sided dice) and the arrow scatter dice. If its a hit then anyone under the Blast marker is hit. Small blast is a 3 inch circle, large is 5 and there are other like flamer templates.

Each units gets Grimm Reaper roll (saving throw) once there health is gone. Roll the dice and its a 50/50 chance of life or death. If its life then place a 1 nect to them for 1 health left. Level 1 units only get to roll the saving throw once. nect time hit they die. Level 2's get two throws up to level 5. Heroes though get to reroll failed throws.

Standard game is kill the enemy army.

HQ mission is destroyed the enemy HQ which has 50 health points. You can upgrade you HQ with guns and traps. Also you can capture building throughout the map. Different building grant various positives like orbital strikes, shields, forward drop zones etc.

void missions is a 1 player or co-op which your uses only your heroes to move around the map trying to find tech to close the worm holes. the worm holes continues to bring in evil flesh eating demonic cannibals (Ravenger's) Each wave bring more baddies and tougher monsters.

Vector missions is a Hero vs Hero combat only. choose your 4-5 unit squad and fight the other unit.

During the standard mission after turn 3 your map is invaded by the Ravenger's which can be a game changer. Ravenger's are player by the game and attack who is close by. Also entering new rooms there may be a chance that Ravenger's are inside.

212984.description:
The game is a push-your-luck and set collection game for 2-4 players. It takes place in a medieval time with Soldiers, Kings and Queens. An average game play takes about 30 to 45 minutes. We recommend you play this game with 3 or 4 players.
In Build Thy Kingdom, you try to collect cards in-game with a little bit of luck and planning. Whoever builds the best Kingdom, wins!

For setup, the deck is shuffled and put on a location where each player can easily reach. The person with most hair starts the game.
The aim of the game is to collect cards, make sets with them and score accordingly.
At the beginning of a player’s turn, the person starts flipping cards from the deck one by one to the side face-up. This is called the field. This way, the cards create a row of cards in the field. At any time of the game, if any two of the same card is revealed on the field, the cards go to the discard pile and the turn moves to the next player clockwise order. This is called a fail. A player can stop at anytime after he/she flipped a card and resolved that card’s action. Then the player takes the revealed cards and puts them in front of him/her. This is called collecting. The collected cards go to the collection.

If a player would flip a card from the deck (not look), and the deck was empty, simply shuffle the discard pile and create a new deck. When the deck fully runs out, including the discard pile, the game ends.

Players gain scores based on specific sets they made.

217083.description:
LYNGK is a synthesis of the first six games of the GIPF Project.

The game is played with 48 pieces in six colors. At the start of play, all colors are neutral and do not belong to any player. During the course of the game, both players must choose two colors. The goal is to make piles of five pieces of different colors whose top color is their own. Whoever has clever tactics, plans for the future, and uses the possibility of multiple moves on stones of their own color will ultimately win with a majority of the 5-stacks.

217085.description:
Reclaim. Rebuild. Remember.

Long ago, your ancestors built great cities across the world. Now your tribe must explore forests, deserts, islands, mountains, and caverns to find these lost cities. Claim the ruins, build places of power, and restore the glory of a bygone age.

Unearth is a dice placement game for 2-4 players designed by Jason Harner and Matthew Ransom. Each player leads a tribe of Delvers, represented by five dice (3 six-sided, 1 four-sided, and 1 eight-sided). Players take turns rolling and placing dice in an attempt to claim Ruins.

The game's elegant core mechanic is accessible to players of all skill levels. High rolls help players claim Ruins, while low rolls help players collect Stones. This opens two paths to victory: claiming sets of Ruins or using Stones to build Wonders.
